ODK_6jS0dRhyMRqmqvX0IQ.text: We waited about 15 minutes. As soon as we were seated our waiter greeted us and asked for our drink order, he returned in a few minutes. Then returned a few minutes later to get our order. We placed it. I ordered Huevos Rancheros and the wife ordered a Cajun Omelette. Both were wonderful and had lots of flavor. Your meals  come with a Baker's Basket, three different types of mini muffins fresh and warm, all three were great. These are brought to you before your meal while you are waiting. Our food came within minutes of finishing the basket. Quick, great service and food. We will return again. Great first experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Country breakfast with Apple wood bacon. Mm mmmm mmmmmm!
Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Mmmmmm muffins while we wait for food.

XK1esPhlWiNOFNFmV9YvTQ.text: I am for sure coming back! Great customer service and food! I recommend ordering the French toast and the potatoes.

Bk0SfzqZ7edcB1Ftp6Wpnw.text: Went here for breakfast for the first time. Took my mom and my 8 year old son.  We waited a while for a table but it wasn't terrible for Sunday morning. The waitress was nice. My food was OK, my over-medium eggs were a little overcooked. My mom had a waffle and she liked it. My son had pancakes eggs and bacon.  He said the scrambled eggs tasted funny and so he only ate a couple of bites. Six hours later here he is throwing up and having diarrhea. Sounds like food poisoning to me. Those scrambled eggs must have been bad.  **UPDATE:  My son is doing better today, but my mother was nauseous this morning.  We hadn't been together until yesterday at brunch in a few weeks so there is no way they passed any type of virus from one to the other that quickly -- this must have been the food.  Disappointing because this place gets 4 stars on Yelp.

cULlwlioPSdQpse2f2K7ow.text: First off thank you for a kind and happy breakfast staff!!! Second thank you for having eggs Benedict at a normal price and a normal flavor!  This place really has it when it comes to the "homemade" meal. I like the new super "Starbucks" type of new age places but I feel they put all the money into the facade and loose it in the food, quality, and staff.   Without the constant bean counters and investors sitting over your shoulder this place has the time to make your food to order. The staff is kind and very helpful too. Also great coffee constantly refilled.   There was a small problem with our meal and within 5 minutes there was a replacement plate and some extra stuff to take home. :)  All things considered this was a great dining experience and I would recommend this place and its people to serve you great meals!   Love it and will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Gooooooooooeeeeeeeyyyyyyy!!!
Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict. Simple, easy, no weird flavors of cream cheese of Jalapeños, or cheddar, or whatever. The Classic. Done Right!
Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Full of people and full of great food. Not a place to be &#34;seen&#34; in, but I place I want to be found in.

REYajlBlVqdn2JOAo9jznA.text: Very great breakfast place. We were very pleased with Susan (our waitress). She gave us the best service and it was also very busy this Sunday morning. Coffee is delicious. Yes you can have a whole waffle for just $1 more and it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Nobody can beat there omelettes! Comes with 3 toppings, just enough!
Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. 3 stack of pancakes! With just the right amount of sugar and warm syrup!
Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Half a waffle, add the the other half for $1 more. :-)

XQ37A47IZL97kwE3OYQKSQ.text: I have visited "Kiss the Cook" several times and I always get a bakers basket warm mini muffins with butter. My favorite are the mini brand muffins. My boyfriend loves the Cajun eggs Benedict. He refuses to try anything else. Staff is wonderful!! I always see the same servers working every time I visit. Makes it feel like one big family is eating breakfast at grandmas house. Absolutely love "Kiss the Cook"

gze6T6JosvpcfKIro47g3Q.text: Kiss the cook is a small, quaint- and I wanna say local but I'm not sure- breakfast/brunch restaurant in Glendale. A lot of their breakfast menu items come with a fresh basket of delicious muffins.  I have tried the mushroom, ham and onion omelette and it tasted very good. The Cooks Combo is the best bang for your buck and comes with eggs, pancake, and sausage or bacon. Coffee and orange juice are both decent. Serive is consistently good but they are pretty busy on Saturday and Sunday mornings.  So make sure to go early or call to put your name on the list. We once waited 20 min outside in the Phoenix summer heat.

Kept coffee and water filled. I had the Cook Combo which was perfect. Eggs Benedict sauce was kind of different tasting... probably won't get that again.  One of the earlier reviews said it was dusty inside but I didn't see a speck of dust anywhere. We will be back!

The tables and chairs are old, country and vintage style, it coordinate with the place so well.  Omggg. The muffin is to die for. We killed it once it hit the table. Haha. EE5Bv849p8npYkcHyMYl0Q.text: Absolutely amazing little place. Food was wonderful. Mini muffins were delectable. Bacon was an it undercooked as I like it crispy but everyone's different. RMC5D2dmb1cmBy3awb_tlw.text: I've been going here occasionally and the food has always been great. My favorite is the Cajun Benedict! The staff is super friendly and the bakers basket is bomb! Would definitely recommend going here, but it can get busy in the mornings. Otherwise great breakfast joint!

89jj5SeuFd9v3qDKT8ij3Q.text: I have driven by here so many times and have always seen how busy it is.  I decided to try it one day and I am glad I did. They serve these little mini muffins that come out hot and fresh. They were so delicious. I ordered the two egg breakfast which came with fried potatoes that tasted like my dad had made them and crispy bacon cooked to perfection. The eggs were cooked just perfect and nice and fluffy.  It is small but very cozy and makes me imagine a small town eatery. The waitress was really great even though she was the waitress on the middle of the week day that I went. Will definitely go back again.

AVKR9-LrOBsd2JV93tQu9g.text: Yes, they do serve mini muffins.They are good but you are now charged for them. kJIvGRcKq44oKQlZAVtkvQ.text: This is the most charming place to eat for breakfast. Delicious food. Awesome service.  We had pancakes. We had eggs. We had omelettes. We had the pecan roll. You name it. Fresh squeezed oj. Bacon. Sausage. Everything was fantastic. You will not be disappointed. We will be back!!!

9yk4WoODwUrXCGi8XP7iqw.text: Loved this place! We sat on the patio with our dog and he received just as amazing of service as we did!! They even had s menu for him.   I got the eggs Benedict and it was great! My husband got the stuffed french toast and I was almost sad that I didn't get that after stealing a bite of his.

KAIePvWigkyIA56ti3_g7Q.text: Kiss the Cook?  Shit - they should fire the cook!  I should have known before visiting that I wasn't going to like the place. After all, the AZ Repugnant rated this place as its #2 pick (behind Matt's Big Breakfast) as the top place to have breakfast in the Valley.  As the six friends who read my reviews know, I've never understood the hoopla around Matt's Big Breakfast - it's OK - but geesh -- #1?  What happened to The Farm at South Mountain -- now that's a unique-fantastic-organic-only-can-find-in-Phoenix-Phoenician experience.  Sigh - but I digress...  Ross and I enter "Kiss the Cook".  The interior is special - hard wood floors, mismatched seats and tables -- we both say it reminds us of a country store.  "Nana" is the one who shows us to our seats.  My hopes rise and I start thinking that AZ Republic scored on it's review.  We order.  Service is friendly, coffee was a little weak, but Ross loves the OJ.  Then the food arrives.    The presentation is impressive.  My omelet was TALL!  FLUFFY!  Both Ross and I were wowed!  Then I cut into it and it was runny, soggy, and tepid (not really warm).  The waitress came by, asked how everything was (and she seemed to really mean it versus the polite ask but they don't really care to know the answer question that usually comes from waiters).  I told her about the omelet and she offered for them to recook it.    She came back with my same omelet that must have been thrown in the microwave.  The top was steaming but interior now warmer - but not yet warm.   I picked around the soggy parts and ate the top (that was Ross' suggestion).  The waitress came back again, concerned that I wasn't eating enough.  She was so sweet.  I didn't want to make her feel badly.  But she sent the manager over -- which I thought was very proactive customer service.  The manager (maybe the owner?), stopped by and asked me what I thought might be wrong and offered up that it might be the egg beaters.  She did not offer me something else (but did suggest the next time I go in I should try the Pecan Cinnamon Roll).  And, when we got our bill, the omelet was still on it (they didn't comp my meal).  We paid and no complaint.  I don't expect to be comped, I just thought the experience with the manager was interesting.

pTgB25fZh6Z9MPO6d9dd-A.text: Food:  Good.  Their muffin basket with mini muffins is really yummy.  3 different kinds, baked fresh.  They give you the basket with so much butter packets I was shocked.  But it was funny enough to take a picture.  Pancakes are Superb.  Light, fluffy, the right temperature, not DRY, and not too soggy... YUM!!!  Their famous potatoes are pretty good, not the best but pretty good.  Regular eggs are ok.  The omelettes are fluffy. The egg yolk ones are firm, the egg white ones are a little too fluffy almost runny.  They have a bunch of other options on the menu like make your own omelettes, huevos rancheros, sandwiches.  Not overally oily. Price:  Decent.  About $5 for 2 eggs, muffins, 2 biscuits with gravy, gradmas potatoes.  About $7 to $8 for make your own omelette.   Decor:  I love the ambience here, it is really quaint, not old scary really nostalgic, but more prairie, baskets hanging, green vines, white linen, and daisy flower kind of feel.  Has a patio Service:  Very good.  Super nice and attentive.  Fast service.  Ask us if we needed anything a lot.

GJzhqLWDuZ_qj5da7rE5Gw.text: I took my daughter here for a girls day on Sunday. The place is so cute inside, not at all what I expected from the outside. It is drenched in country decor, but in a good way. I love how stuff did not match perfectly, like the chairs and the plates.  They were actually closed when we arrived at 1:06 pm, but they gladly encouraged us to come in. The Hostess was a young lady that had a down to earth friendly personality and even complimented my daughter on her necklace. Our server was just as lovely and was very attentive the entire time.  I ordered the eggs benedict ($7.50) and my daughter ordered a turkey sandwich on sourdough ($4.50). They delivered the delicious muffins that were mentioned in the previous post...we had banana nut and zucchini muffins and they were sooooo yummy.  The food came out in no time at all and was very very pleased with the benedict and the potatoes that came with. The eggs were perfectly poached and hollandaise sauce was delish.The potatoes were just like I make at home, perfectly seasoned with  little crispy pieces here and there. I was impressed because I have paid a lot more for this elsewhere and did taste nearly as good. The daughter's turkey sandwich was stacked high with thinly sliced turkey and cheese and she was also very satisfied.   I will definetly return here and would recommend trying it if you are in the area. The service and the food were both great and that is no easy task.

bNxzhNFOtoqnKAk4H6o_mg.text: I absolutely LOVE Kiss the Cook. It is the cutest little place for breakfast and I love going here.  The quaint little restaurant is decorated with country antiques and most of them are for sale. It reminds me of a place you would find in Prescott.  I have had a few things on the menu and have always been delighted. The coffee is a little week, but then again, I start each day with a quad espresso so it may be unfair for me to judge.  While you wait for breakfast they bring out a variety of VERY tasty muffins and bread... so, so tasty!!!!  Good service and prices. No complaints from me :)

ao3zI03q_a2wDoGreHp75w.text: So you have to love breakfast.  It is a great meal that really begs for creativity.  There are so few places that have creative breakfasts (Palette was one) but most places just do the standard fare.  That would be Kiss the Cook.  Nothing special about it.  No magic applewood smoked turkey sausage with kumquat glaze, no french waffels - just your standard stuff.  They do it well though.  Think of it as basic breakfast without the grease.    The waitresses are great and have a ton of personality.  They really make this place a Four Star establishment.  The mini muffins that come before your meal is always a saving grace and they are the perfect size to tide you over till your food arrives.  That being said, your food won't take too long and you will get plenty of it.    I tried the french toast with a side of ham.  The toast was decent; with a hint of cinnamon.  Nice but not amazing.  The ham was a really good size and it tasted damn good.  The fresh squeezed OJ wasn't as good as Matt's but it was better than something from a carton.   I'd go back here if I was out in Glendale for breakfast.  A great place with a ton of character.  The food isn't overwhelming but it is good enough for breakfast.

NaaSU2B5g_9Fgqh6ums8KQ.text: We really like this restaurant, but do not go there more often, because their coffee is just not good. We tried it again this morning, and love the restaurant, the food, and the service, but the coffee is still not good,it is weak, not very flavorful, and this morning tasted a little burnt.

GnoCbbptz3XDZ6Oi_-draA.text: My sister was visiting and I wanted to take her somewhere special for breakfast. Kiss the Cook from what I read online sounded like a great place. When we got there it took a little while for service to begin. I actually had to ask someone for some attention. We were a large table of ten. Boy, once our waitress came she made up for the wait. The food was great and so was the service. It was a special meal, a unique place and the food was wonderful. Everyone at our table kids included were satisfied and happy. I highly recommend Kiss the Cook for a special breakfast spot.

sA0ITx4OFCXF1m-DsTZ69A.text: Solid place.   It's a pretty down home breakfast spot in an iffy part of Glendale. We sat outside on the patio, much more comfortable than the crowded indoors, on a nice Winter Sunday (the only downside to being outside is some traffic noise which I think is tolerable).  Breakfast highlights were GREAT ham, pancakes, omelets.  Highly touted pecan sweet rolls and muffin basket were fine, but overhyped. Potatoes were fine but nothing special.  Prices are very reasonable.   Oh, and the waitresses are super nice. Always tip well!

oyj14-lqFyKck1nOFHo1TQ.text: It's Mother's Day and I knew restaurants would be crowded.  Imagine my surprise when this restaurant says they take reservations!  They say it was a 45 minute wait at that time, so I put my name down for 45 minutes.  We hurried to get there on time and they said it would be 20 minutes for a table... pardon me?  You said it was a reservation and now there's a 20 minute wait ON TOP of the reservation time?  After waiting 35 minutes with 2 very hungry children (I asked for some muffins for them and was given one for each of the kids, and then a waitress saw them cranky still and gave them another one, which was nice) we were finally seated.  The hostess asked if the table was fine and I had to bite the insides of my cheeks to keep from saying, "It'll have to do because I'm not waiting longer for another table!"  We saw people that got there after us in 4 party tables get seated before us because they were complaining.  WTF?  If they can't wait their turn, there's a Sonic down the street with no wait.  Anyway, we were seated and ordered quickly.  My 6 year old got the Cooks Combo, my 3 year old got the yogurt parfait (we changed the fruit to strawberries and bananas because they used honeydew, cantaloupe and pineapple in theirs, which sounded gross and a concoction that would result in curdled yogurt if the pineapple was fresh!)  I got the crab cake eggs Benedict (it was on special), and my husband got eggs with turkey sausage and potatoes.  We were given a basket of cold muffins, which were tasty but not piping hot like Missy's review.  The food came out quickly, which was surprising because they were quite busy.  Our waitress was a very nice lady and welcomed the change in the yogurt parfait (I really hate when waitresses get snippy if you change something very slight!)  Everyone was happy with their food.  I was mildly annoyed that the eggs weren't poached properly, they were overdone, resulting in no glorious egg yolk mixing with the Hollandaise, but other than that I would order that dish again.  We probably won't be back again though because it's a bit of a drive, a long wait, and I felt like I was stuck in a Seinfeld episode (a mesh of the car reservation episode and the Chinese restaurant episode).  The service was friendly, the food was good, but if you can't keep reservations, don't take them and sure as heck don't offer them!

AtDXml33t70eQZQvmlNBMg.text: Had breakfast here Sunday. It was such a great experience. Everyone was happy, and smiley. The food was great, and not pricey. They have very cute concepts such as the muffin baskets, and "kisses" they give you with your bill. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great food and a happy atmosphere.

hG3pO2BHyNYy84zJZaASNQ.text: I'm not really a fan.  The country cute decor is something I can get over but the food was overpriced, the service sucked and the place was super dirty.  We were sitting right next to the owners and if you can't get good service when sitting next to the big boss - it's a sign of trouble.  I would have given a 3 star but used the bathroom before leaving.  Well, I went into the bathroom anyways... didn't use it.  Totally disgusting and I have a feeling the kitchen isn't much better.  They should serve eggs-Benedict and french roast coffee to work with the country decor.  The place could be a gem but instead it's just a crapper

pAsFqBt5igAznjI3abmb-w.text: Meh. I've experienced MUCH MUCH better.  Please keep in mind I have eaten here for several years now, but this past year has been a real disappointment.   The coffee is so weak any flavor you get is from the added cream.   The eggs benedict  was over cooked to the point where the yellow solid. So, I sent it back and was treated to runny whites the next time.   Clearly this is something they need to work on.        A few months ago we experienced the same exact problem which is why it took so long for me to give them another chance in the first place.  I, for one will not be going back nor can I, in good faith, recommend them.  Seriously, and I can't believe I am saying this, but Denny's is better.  Mimi's is REALLY my recommendation for a decent breakfast at decent prices. Last note, the staff was okay, but I ended up getting charged for the two coffees we had while waiting for food we never ate.

bx5UErLuSLRVrsuUEyOQ-g.text: Back in the day I would have gave Kiss the Cook a solid 3.  Not any more.  The last few times we've been there have been worse and worse.  The last visit was the final straw.  The bakers basket ( a few muffins) were undercooked.  YUCK!  The eggs were cold and dry.  The potatos were still hard.  Even the service was no good.  I dont know what happened to this place.  It used to be a cool dive for breakfast.  Not any more.  The two comments about slapping the cook and firing the cook are spot on.  The real punch in the gut was that there was a poster on the door that was begging patrons to go online and request that they be casted on DDD.  I emailed the link but instead of asking them to use Kiss the cook on an episode, I urged them to avoid eating there at all costs.  Get it together.

fjJW5pY_wlT4iO7bMGL2GA.text: This place sucks the food sucks and so does the old ugly staff that serves it. I would rather starve. This place is called Kiss the Cook...but once you have eaten here you'll want to slap the cook!!!!! Save your money and avoid this place. It just isn't sanitary.

FKxcvSh9-M5RPzM2YYiEyA.text: lEveryone raves about kiss the cook.  It's ok but there are some other places just as good.  Menu is fairly limited.  Muffins come with each order.  Waitresses are fun and sassy. Place is usually crowded when we go in.  Like I said, everyone goes crazy over it but me and for me it's ok.

JbOhfaN2LmwTEn5eYyOqmw.text: I had the corned beef hash and eggs.  Lose 1 star for unseasoned potatoes.  Gain it back for scratch corned beef.  Lose two stars for weird ambiance.  I get the look they are going for, but the chairs were down right uncomfortable.  Gain 1 star back for great coffee, and frequent refills.  I think that gets me to four.  Very well priced-good value for the money.  Service was wonderful.

BIWj4mLkKFE9Yk10i0C2vA.text: Awesome place. The pancakes are delicious. The staff and atmosphere were absolutely terrific. You can actually Kiss the Cook. A table next to me had the Chef come out, gave him a huge hug and kiss on the cheek.  The restaurant clapped and cheered!  What a wonderful memory  : )

EM6HDSSy1jbVx4jPUfN4XA.text: Kiss the Cook is so old school! Its a charming little place that's good to take the family or friends to enjoy breakfast. I use to live near by here and was first taken by people that raved about this place. I was surprised that they were right on about how good the food was. I am not a morning/breakfast person, but for Kiss the Cook I will get my lazy butt up to enjoy.

LvSoM-jt8dWcpwdwegm1kQ.text: I am a Kiss the Cook fan.  Pretty much everyone I know in Glendale is too.  I guess it's just a Glendale thing. But the food is similar to any of the other breakfast joints, but I think it's slightly better here. Not better than Chompies mind you, but better than the Good Egg.  They're only open for breakfast and lunch, but I've only ever had their breakfast items.  They have the best pancakes, scrambled eggs and waffles.  YUM.  They're reasonably priced too, so you can take the whole fam and still not break the bank.

umobLIjLwUZKxlPgTFAOcA.text: It was a Sunday afternoon 1ish, hubby and i woke up way late lol, and we wanted some good breakfast food. Got on yelp and found kiss the cook. probably would not have stopped if I hadn't found it on here. The building is kind of older and not a big eye catcher. The inside is really nice and cozy though. got the food to go, took it home and was pleasantly surprised at just how much food we got for the money we spent.

wkJbRThe5S99UoS0RC1dVA.text: Best breakfast place in Phoenix!!! Hands down. Had an egg white Cajun omelette. Unbelievable!!!!! And the pancakes where off the hook. A great place to be at.  They prefer cash. Keep that in mind.

kv4pTOUhjclD1edSknRoOg.text: Very home feel place. Good was amazing. And the muffins were to die for. They had mis match chairs to sit in which made me fall in love with it. It is a small place so it gets busy and packed quick.

6i-5kKcgyL0oZl0uJv9upg.text: Ok guys! I seriously cannot hey enough of this place. If I could I would eat this every day for breakfast. The mini muffins are to die for. The customer service reminds me of back home (Texas). The French toast & eggs Benedict are some of my favs. I crave this place daily!

JWRUOBlOEH2zTeoabzp2jg.text: This place was amazing. The food was delicious and the service was wonderful. Friendly and fast. We will definitely be going back

sM5AUDrPId0ASxshWiIrLA.text: Great food. Friendly staff. I had the corned beef hash which was good. This is definitely a place I will return to in the future. They give you a Hershey's kiss after the visit. I thought that was a cute idea.

-TH-aJU8D38-HJjjxo78cg.text: Food was delicious. Only downfall is the place is small inside. Definitely comfort food!

GGRBwgRLUfzs_HhKT_T1eA.text: I believe this restaurant rivals Matt's big breakfast as one of the top places in phoenix

ZQSZx7W6_r0TD9ai2n0DmA.text: The food was good, but the server, I think her name is Dawn... Didn't smile once, didn't say the specials, yelled at us when we ordered an iced coffee to make sure we knew it isn't refillable, seriously felt like we had to walk on egg shells.  Forgot my coffee.. but I looked around, and at least she wasn't the only one she was being rude with.  If I ever come back, I'll have to make sure she isn't my server.  But I probably won't, I don't like to feel like I'm burdening someone.

-TOApU_LiGAHy3Uvw2zOng.text: Great breakfast place with delicious specials.  We love the mini muffins served in a basket with the meals.

xhHLiA9mKNRHCVhaE045KQ.text: Been going here forever! Love it and their bakers basket ! Little muffins and butter they serve. Always great customer service.

awiHW48Hy7gu-rCmoXieoQ.text: Came to this place because I noticed it had 4 out of 5 stars. And I love trying local joints! This place is super cute, quite quirky decor to match the cute name. We got seated right away, not crowded but then again it's a Thursday morning. Our waitress really didn't have a personality. I notice there are 3 servers and the other two seem really attentive to there tables.   Food was good, not overly impressed. The grandmas basket was cute a little different. Will I come back? Yes if I was in the area. Not gonna drive out of my way.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Bakers basket

snPcydqcxeeLpSFswizjPQ.text: I've been going to this place since I was a little girl and let me tell you if you really want good breakfast and brunch I would recommend coming here. It's great for groups, bringing you're significant other or you're family here. There food is so delicious especially there little mini muffins but in the menu I recommend the toasted wheat B.L.T sandwich with egg overhard inside the sandwich with a side of lays chips. Omg it's so yummy but other stuff on the menu is also yummy as well. Also the servers are great but if you want someone very reliable & fast I would ask for Steven or Michelle. And if you ever go on the weekends I would call in and tell them to put you on the waiting list so you don't have to wait long when you get there. But overall if want a good food for breakfast and brunch I would come here Cause this place is the best.

SGWhlCCgVCy42BISwEuZoQ.text: They made politics part of the food so I had to stop going here. I stand with light rail in Glendale!

YHl14fB70EDS-rMV9eoMzw.text: We love this place!! Great homemade food and awesome service!!. Oh, and the biscuits are a treat!

0pvfS2aGDuWMhc_euZTPWg.text: If you love breakfast, they have great ones!  The other food is good too, but love their breakfast selection! The place is always hopping! Service is excellent and coffee hot! You can even buy a souvenir mug! Unique decor and warm, friendly environment!

DNsfqOpAr-oRamRFGs7c9g.text: This place is adorable, it reminds of a sweet little Granny's home! Our server was as kind as could be & started us off with some delicious muffins that we devoured. I ordered their biscuits & gravy which was pretty good! I would try them again. My toddler loved looking around at everything in the restaurant. Would come back for breakfast.

LcyBsmBBnXW_N3PRvL4fgw.text: I love this place!! Hubby and I decided to go someplace different for breakfast. The restaurant has the ambiance like Cracker Barrel when you walk in, old fashioned restaurant. The people are nice servers actually talk to you and check on you to refill drinks. The mini Muffins are to die for and the food as well. We had the pancakes, apple bacon and sausage links with potatoes. Very delicious. We will be returning again!!

SDRrbusU0yyoziD4liZE1Q.text: The best eggs benedict I've had in a longtime. Sooo good! Definitely recommend them. Also the mini muffins were delicious. Staff was very nice and accommodating as well.

RYxrWEpTgIRXsdzkD1BJNw.text: A charming place with really yummy fresh food and the mix of mismatched plates and decor really give it a homey feeling.  If it's busy (and it usually is) get ready to stand while you wait for your table! There are less than 30 tables at KtC so it can get uncomfortably cramped while you're waiting to be seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Country Breakfast ($6.25)! 2 eggs, fried potatoes, bacon (+$1.50), and a biscuit and gravy!
Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. A GIANT cajun omelet ($8.75)! Stuffed with delicious kielbasa, bell peppers, onions, Monterey Jack cheese!

4ehpl9hLIv7giEIQJvJb6A.text: Great breakfast, great service, great food,  the Biscuits and Gravy are the best I have had in AZ.  The Omelet was phenomenal.  We will definitely return! OFTEN.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States

caC80XP9N_u_yT1y4l3ghA.text: Barely warm food. Had to be returned to be warmed up in the microwave. Our table was not the only table to have food sent back due to the temperature. Disappointing. First and last time at this restaurant.

VHlW0uq-787HEMhRQDCq5A.text: Great food. Great  service. The waffle was tasty. My Tom omelet was awesome. Our waiter was on top of everything.  We didn't need anything he's awesome.  We went to this  restaurant because we saw it on a TV show. the kids enjoyed the Hershey kiss at the end. We would definitely come back again

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Not for kids but tasty
Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Tom&#39;s omlette. Yummy
Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Waffle was on point

9S7NSKnkGkNjg0AQeeN7tw.text: The owner was our waitress and super nice!  We sat outside on a perfect October morning.  Great selection, great prices.  It has a more "homey" feel than other places and I love that they leave a pitcher of water on the table.  I had the pecan cinnamon roll which was delicious!  My friend had the 3 cheese grilled cheese and pasta salad which was also yummy.  My other friend had an omelet which came with a basket of mini muffins.  The zucchini one was the best!  They even welcome dogs in their outdoor seating area.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Pecan cinnamon roll
Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Pecan cinnamon roll

Gcp6oVnJVNGy4SsFDlC2Dg.text: Great little breakfast spot. Come early because it gets full.  I've been coming here for years whenever I am on that side of town. It has never let me down. Good old fashioned home cooking.

FMj7UlYMkp5LyjBu0AyllQ.text: Loved this place.  Had an excellent scramble.  Potatoes were fantastic.  Bought a mug.  Best breakfast I have had in years.

N4q9PeLzsMOifD-r_-EfgQ.text: Nice MA and PA business.  Our waiter was on point. He continously making sure we had everything we need. Unlike other waiters/waitress who only do it in the beginning. The muffins were moist and delicious. We ordered French toast with the Applewood bacon. They were cooked just right.  Our favorite breakfast place.

xR02-CsjoTa-BQUE3rWMMg.text: Love this place. Everyone so friendly, food very good. I have ordered pies, they are delicious, plus saves me from having to make them. This is the place to go.

ulN8BYSkvFyiFLoAJqLuoQ.text: Great place for Sunday brunch, my mom and I didn't have to wait long. They bring out a basket of mini muffins prior to your meal, and the meal itself was Delicious. The service wasn't so great we has to keep waiving  down our waitress to refill our drinks. Other  than that every else was great

hNkehRx5V6EKRiSsjMv7_w.text: Kiss the cook is by far one of the best breakfast places I've been to in a long time, the service is amazing, the food is to die for and the ambience of trinkets is just delightful. If you're in the Glendale area and want an amazing breakfast, kiss the cook is the place.

w33PTSrargyozDUCzNsWOw.text: Beeeeeeest Breakfast ever!!!!!!! The place is cute and vintage looking! The male waiters are very good looking white boys! Makes u wana put then on a plate and enjoy!! Very satisfied with this place! The waffle is to diee for!!!!

MjCv5yUpJ4FEYMsVPO5jtQ.text: Love going here! My last two visits were decent. The server honestly, was rude, I do not remember her name; but seriously, every other time I have been here EVERYONE is so nice. Also, the potatoes seem to be slightly undercooked, again this is a more recent thing happening here, I am guessing there is a newer cook. The biscuits and gravy, Cajun omelet and the coffee are to die for!! Definitely somewhere you should try at least once, anyone I have every taken here has become a huge fan and always comes back

8yFV1A6B_Lk4d2p1PB3FXA.text: It's just ok in my book. My omlet was good, as were the potatoes. My husband ordered the corn beef hash and upon ordering he asked if they make it from scratch, waitress said, "yes, it was." We think it's canned and then doctored up. My kids had a ham sandwich, also just ok. I think the best part about breakfast was the fresh squeezed juice.

n2jRJd0xbFjgGlTFRUNvXw.text: I love this place! Whenever I can convince someone to get up early and eat some awesome biscuits and gravy, it is the best day ever! Seriously, I recommend the biscuits and gravy... plus the atmosphere is pretty neat. Kinda reminds me of a Grandma who hordes country decor lol.... they have great food though.

WSFw0mohXZjT6K9BinzPZQ.text: I've lived in glendale almost my entire life, this place is a gem. Love everything about it. The food is great (I always get breakfast), the servers are wonderful and the price is right. They even have homemade dog treats!

oCT6A5OnWv7Ar7jj0zNFeQ.text: My fist time here I really liked it I had the cook plate The buttermilk pancakes where  so good .  it's way better than Denny's & IHOP and all those big chain companies . Oh and is way cheaper too !

137zLGeUIB03uixXklNjpg.text: Cozy place. Good prices. Had the Cajun omelette not spicy and lots of flavor. Pancakes are delicious fluffy and buttery

xl6ZGfFRcOOLkAlwMVmr8g.text: What a great little breakfast joint! Usually pretty busy and has quite the wait. We've gotten lucky a couple of times but definitely await on weekends. That said it's well worth the wait. The food is made to order and tastes like something you'd get at grandma's.  I've tried the French Toast,  waffles pancakes and chicken salad sandwich and they are all heavenly. Depending what you are in the mood for I'd vouch for any of those. I love the interior it's very quaint. Tables with chairs that don't match, tea sets in the cupboards along the back wall. My mom, daughter and I love to go for a girl's day brunch once a month.

-aJCV9bW1AmyvGbR--hJLA.text: Gone here couple times before and always like their garden eggs benedict. But this time I decided to change it up a bit and order their chorizo eggs benedict. It wasnt what I expected. Burnt, no pinto de gallo, pototoes was cold. Wasn't happy. My fiance got the corn beef hash, thumbs down. had to ask them to remake it. it was burnt yet soggy in the inside. overall not happy. used to be good. idk what happened. the cook probably had a rough morning. lol

DIsCxoWX2F80ClkJInyndw.text: We had a great breakfast! We had the garden bene and the country breakfast. Both were excellent! The staff was very friendly and helpful. We only had to wait a few minutes even though it was busy. We will definitely be back!

WH7i_oypPEu2MJhL_casQw.text: There was about a 15 min wait when we arrived however it seemed like there was always a 15 min wait to be seated for people. Usually a good sign of a great place to eat, and in the end was worth it.  Food was excellent. Service was great too. Great little place to dine at.

QPfgpFNjtwH0Z48rcbgi-g.text: Charming place.  The food is good.  I had the cooks special with pancakes, eggs and bacon.  I also had their potatoes.  The potatoes could be better.  Everything else was good.  The best part is the muffins you get upon being seated and the freshly squeezed orange juice.  This place attracts a lot of older people.  We were probably one of the youngest in the room.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Mini muffins.

eXgDLo1YvzCA8A2cs5XBiQ.text: Wait staff seemed like they were having a hard day, snapping at each other and not overly friendly to the customers. The basket of mini muffins was the best part of our meal. Just regular breakfast fare, nothing special. Restaurant could have been cleaner, not in a great part of town. Homeless /transient population hanging out in the parking lot, made it feel somewhat unsafe.

CIfsnkAL2c9ZPOVL6hG12w.text: Kiss The Cook has one of the best (if not the best) eggs benedict I have ever had, given that I'm a huge fan of eggs benedict. The gravy is amazing! Sausage is not too salted (which is usually the case at other places) and eggs are perfectly poached in a way that yolk is still runny but doesn't spill all out when cut. The mini muffins offered before the meals are ridiculously delicious - not too sweet, not too oily, and not to filling. I would definitely come back if I visit Arizona again.

3GFFJ9lkNlFcW-NMakrVmA.text: Can't beat their Cajun omelette. Absolutely the best breakfast for the money anywhere in the Phoenix area. I wouldn't be afraid to bring anyone here.

M57REroxtuy0wYjRwsd40w.text: Yummy breakfast options are slim around my boyfriend's house which is why I am so grateful for Kiss the Cook. We can all use a little kitsch with our breakfasts and Kiss the Cook has it in spades. Mismatched chairs and plates mixed in with country style antiques add some interest to your just awakening eyes.   The food is tasty and homey. They start you off with a lovely basket of mini muffins (bran, strawberry and zucchini) which are piping hot and yummy. The zucchini is my favorite. They serve their coffee in clear glass mugs which I love because you get to watch the cream and coffee mix together. The food is really solid, I haven't had anything I didn't like yet. Their eggs benedict is quite good and their pancakes are really good.  The waitresses are friendly and quick with your order. The prices are fair. Now that its not an oven outside the patio is open so wait times have improved. In fact, over the weekend there wasn't a wait at all. This is a great, locally owned breakfast place to try out.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Huevos Rancheros
Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Muffin Basket with zucchini, raisin bran and strawberry muffins.
Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Cook&#39;s Combo

4D0l2IA-AB7Rd-S3xKrfJQ.text: Even tho I had a bad customer experience, I can't deny  how good the food is....I love places that has Mom's homemade taste to it....and they have that....I love recommend....I do...I do

-V_9Xu8CC6FU8UioujFzxQ.text: I am happy to live close again because now we can enjoy Kiss the Cook's awesome muffin basket, great service and delicious food at a good price. We have been eating here for years and we're always impressed. I love the eggs Benedict so much...I literally want to kiss the cook! If my wife will let me. And if the cook is female. If not then my wife has a kiss for the cook? Let's just say we highly recommend Kiss the Cook.

I_JIIGZ8fOokotZY6DM10Q.text: I like it here. Small place that was packed when I walked in. Got my food quick and had excellent service by Susan. I just wanted a simple breakfast and it tasted wonderful. Definitely a good spot to go to for quick food.

TFtPlm_mnvo0TLXbZDQYrA.text: Very vintage and cute! The food is so good including the fresh mini muffins provided before your meal! Zucchini is my fav! Really good omelets and potatoes, sweet customer service! It's a bit small so I'm not sure how they fit people in if their busy but well worth going!

lkXJorAKb7xF99sBr8W8Lg.text: this is a good breakfast place. i especially love their cajun style benedict. big servings and good food. you might want to arrive early during breakfast hours as the place can get quite busy. servers are friendly. the only thing is that space is quite tight.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. cajun style bene!

Cs_HoV9ndIQyfm3ZdOlU5w.text: YAY! Good food and such friendly people. Sometimes my partner and I don't get such a great reception but this place loves the GAYS!! Can't beat the prices either...will definitely be returning :)

eI1_hIIbJnU_xOIv0ebs6Q.text: This place has excellent breakfast. The biscults and gravy are amazing. Fresh coffee. The parking is a little small for full size trucks. Home style breakfast is a speciality here.

v3pzxfJew4UeGuX1P0UHOw.text: It is our tradition to have breakfest here every Christmas eve. Never disapointed, always satisfied, and filled with good food.

iTUpbNvysm1qEb5kHkpe9Q.text: The staff is nice, but slow. I have only eaten breakfast here. Nothing bad, nothing good. The food is bland and basic.

BGOEA-YjO531VCQXlKkTqA.text: I was not sure what to expect when I found this little place.  But what I found in a restaurant where the food is good, the help is friendly, and it definitely has a personality!    First, the food is good,  I have eaten there twice with a friend and both times our food was cooked to our specifications, was tasty, and was served quickly.   This is no austere setting.  The tables and chairs are all different, there are shelves holding all manner of things ranging from older kitchen ware, cutsie signs and at the register, they sell home made dog treats.  The food is well portioned, and the coffee was pretty darn good.      The only reason this is not a 5 is that the entry way is cramped and confusing.  They are doing the check out and greeting area in the same small place.  It does not work well for me.

hVnpsRsUkhMyMauloCwr_g.text: I brunched at this quaint little diner recently with a friend and was not disappointed.   I ordered the corned beef hash and she, an omelette off the specials. Everything was great, and the warm little muffins were excellent! Make sure your order comes with the baker's basket.  Our server was very cheerful, and prompt. The atmosphere reminded me of eating breakfast at grandma's house, a happy feeling to be sure.

muXkpIw-pVTfDvIOlZjPxA.text: This place has been around for a while and for good reasons. They have affordable and delicious food. I've only ever had their breakfast and everytime it has been delicious. I recently went two weekends in a row and both times did not dissapoint. The first time I got their Cajun Style Eggs Benedict. I ordered mine over medium. The eggs came out perfect and the sauce they use in lieu of hollandaise was to die for. I mean I just want to smother all my food with it. It was the right amount of spicy and the right amount of flavor. The breakfast comes with their world famous mini muffins. The second time I got their traditional breakfast with pancakes. The PANCAKES are amazing. Fluffy to perfection and just topped off with enough butter. I also ordered a waffle and let me tell you. I loved the Waffle. It wasn't overtly sweet and it was crispy on the outside. They have applewood smoked bacon that is pretty delicious. The only negative thing that I can say about this place is that their coffee sucks. Sometimes you get those clear glass coffee cups and you can see straigh through it with coffee in it. I love strong strong coffee and even Denny's serves stronger coffee than this. The service at this mom and pop place is amazing. Every single employee makes you feel at home. They treat you like family and are great at making food recomendations. Overall, this place is good, cheap and delicious. Don't let the long line scare you away because it sure does get busy.

mzCJP2-I3kL3OGODIiE7vA.text: Loved this place lots of cute decorations good service awesome basket of muffins come free with your meal. The breakfast was great and the owner or chef was making homemade pumpkin butter while we were there. All said great place for breakfast.

vXMXv2gfuH-CXeHBjg9STQ.text: I really liked this place. It's your typical diner food, pancakes, Omelets, steak and eggs, but they're actually very satisfying. The inside is a little small so thankfully it was a cool morning for the patio. The people are very friendly and helpful. Great place and good food! We'll be coming back again :)

U7T2qiXaQtifvwXM-xYppA.text: I was very pleasantly surprised by my first visit to "Kiss the Cook". My family and I visited for the first time on a Sunday. The restaurant is instantly welcoming and cozy. The place smelled like coffee and muffins. The menu had a lot of tasty dishes I would love to try next time I visit, like crepes and pancakes but I went with an omelette and home fries. I enjoyed my food. The food, the service, the atmosphere all felt like the staff  cares about the experience the patrons have.  Did I mention the muffins? They offer a complimentary basket of mini muffins for the table with certain dishes (I think that's how it works, I'm not sure).  The muffins were warm, moist and delicious. The coffee is served in glass cups.  I prefer mugs but I appreciate that they have a signature thing.  I wish the coffee was better but it certainly wasn't bad. I also liked that they offer flavored coffee.  The place was full when we visited.  It's a really nice, laid back restaurant and I look forward to coming back. I would have come sooner but when I would see their signage from the car as we drove by I was worried because it seemed a bit outdated.  I didn't know what that would mean if we went inside.  Upon visiting, my experienced proved to be very positive.  I like this place.

KNIibfrwp6Is2FWcDtEX4w.text: I will keep this review short and sweet:  Come here.   The staff was extremely friendly and attentive. The waffles, crisp on the outside and fluffy on the inside. I ordered the biscuits and gravy (my wife had the waffles) and it was delicious. The biscuits were fluffy and not super dense like other places I have been.   Oh, to top it off, you get a little "Bakery Basket" with a bunch of mini muffins. They were warm and scrumptious too.   Usually, i write longer reviews, but I think this place should be experienced on your own. Just know, it is awesome (and seriously, get the waffles)!

0z2H9x_YUi_P0m3LzLRLdA.text: We visited this restaurant when we went to AZ on vacation and we were so sad that we had to leave it. Lol. The food was amazing, staff also amazing, CAJUN SAUCE WAS THE MOST AMAZING THING EVER!! Can't wait to go back to AZ JUST for this place next year  (and to be honest, that Cajun sauce is making me consider moving to AZ. )

w8r0dpSiyuJ4E0ryfUjJkA.text: Love the decor and the food. Been there twice so far and both times the server was borderline rude. She either hates her job or was having a bad day both times we were there. Bottom line:  5 star food, minus 2 stars for crappy service.

TOTIQL4KHywMHBE48kanDA.text: Amazing waffles! I absolutely loved all the food and service at this restaurant. The chairs are a bit uncomfortable but I did like food.

vmocarWr6TvtV39ikpQTwA.text: Okay. I was expecting to much maybe?  Based on the reviews from this place I expected to find less lacking in all areas of this place.  When you arrive you sign in like some sort of Drs office, I am positive that some folks that came into line after me were seated first, the wait staff knew them by name.  After being seated we waited several minutes to be seen, (no surprise) they were very busy. Once we were seen we had already decided what we wanted to eat but the waitress took our drink order and simply turned and walked away.  No "I'll be right back" or a single word.  Then we got the basket of muffins and I had one and could not tell what kind it was and it was dry.  Then the coffee arrived in a liquor glass, clear,  the coffee was so see through that I am able to view the room by looking thru it.  The food arrived and there were a few potato's but not many on the side and a huge omelet. The issue was the menu itself.  Breakfast was eggs and more eggs with some small number of other choices to go along with the eggs and more eggs.  I asked for bacon on my omelet and while it may have been there in spirit it was not there at all in flavor and I saw none in my omelet. Also the omelet eggs seemed to be the kind that come in the cartoon not the actual shell.  I have no idea what the waitress's name was as it was never offered, however in truth there is not a need for that I guess, but still.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. See through brown liquid that this place calls coffee.

YyxdLRpfJGI2r_8WWGT5Fg.text: Stopped here the morning of my dads funeral. He always had bacon & eggs for breakfast on the weekends. Being from Ohio I decided to check out local small businesses. Found this one with decent reviews. Small family owned restaurant.  Love the homey feel and food portions were on point! Vanilla coffee was great as well! Would definitely recommend this place to locals and visitors as well!

30pEvJYey1OBYpeaG8x7Lw.text: We loved their scratch cooking but after I saw the condition of the Ladies bathroom I gagged. (Floor was also just filthy.) Tried alerting the owner in a polite manner but she turned her back on me while trying to entice a small stray dog outside the restaurant.  Rude.  The waitresses have to clean the bathroom. The very people who serve your food!  Can't bring myself to return. Every time I visualize what I saw, I cringe.  This is a True review.  I'm so regretful I didn't take photos and post them.

MPmJtxAm8UDlae6IuNw7lA.text: Took my significant other for her birthday.   Thought we would start the day with a lovely breakfast.  Restaurant was small was felt really cozy and had a rustic interior design.  The muffins were a great touch instead of bread that is typically (toast with too much butter).  I ordered an omelette that I made my own.  Ate a bit of it and something didn't taste right.  Decided not to proceed.  Within a few hours of our dining experience I had severe sickness and wont be looking to visit again.  Service was great but unfortunately only takes one food scare for me.

qdUKTsrFFimZk9qNLxo7PA.text: Very nice people and accommodating but the muffins and cinnamon rolls are microwaved and the place is dirty. Chipped plates and the napkins used in their muffin basket stained and dirty. Sad because I really wanted to like this place.

h1R5riHoQ-F6Z8pY5L540A.text: Place is adorable we came in got a table right away than made our order 10-14 mins later two more tables are witted next to us and made their orders and got served before us I Order Huevos rancheros and yuck just not my cup of tea  everything on my plate was chop big chunks of potatoes big chunks of tomatoes and onions everywhere just could eat it of how moist the "fried tortilla was " the muffins are amazing the iced coffee was also outstanding the servers were really nice other than that just stay away from huevos rancheros .

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. So hard to eat

MenQ3iS-bKGJ_2XhVBc5SA.text: Average food, small portions and overpriced. The service was good, cute setting. I am not sure that it's worth returning though

5AiP0bQQoqgVBKrbXDKVIQ.text: Love this little place, sweet servers who give you that mom vibe. (Hopefully that's not offensive lol)

sLOGMd-Ip0ruAZGomYULqQ.text: Fantastic place for breakfast! Loved the small, homey environment. Service was fast and very friendly. Food was delicious, filling, and wasn't greasy or unhealthy-feeling. I'd definitely eat here again!

N4p6JkdVFJI_uYTD4llJpQ.text: Came here this morning for breakfast and what a treat it was! Nice down home vibes. Reminds you of grandma's house with the decorations. Big portions and small prices. Nice option to try rather than going to the typical well known restaurant chains.

tkzXqMByXFZphKKOxH_jNQ.text: This was my first time here. My server was great; very attentive. I had the Belgian waffle, a pancake, side of potatoes, and orange juice. Everything was really good. My favorite was the Belgian Waffle, it was AMAZING!!!! Will defiantly be going back.

EIOri-dAa6HGdMG2buqbWg.text: Love how this place looks.. so antique and the food is also so good.. service is amazing and serving sizes are more than enough.

7Zrfkx-ckbyJbQVY2iFEYg.text: Came here with my sister in law and nephew. Ha we had just left a different restaurant because we weren't fond of their food. Checked Yelp and this place came up. It's very cute on the inside and they have outside sitting (not that you'd want too in 117 weather). They have a covered patio where customers can wait.   As far as the seating, it was quick even though it was busy and extremely small on the inside. Our server was polite and friendly and I really appreciate that about busy businesses.   The food was really good and the apple smoked bacon was huge and crispy. The pancakes had a great flavor to it. I didn't have coffee but I noticed they serve coffee in clear glasses. I thought that was cool.  Anyway... overall good experience and will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Basket of muffins

b1lwjC2ai0ok_0zgZhxvuw.text: First time at Kiss the Cook. It was busy but they have coffee available while you wait. I got seated pretty quickly since I was by myself. Food and service was good. They don't give out the WiFi password apparently so if you are dining alone, bring a book.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Corned beef hash and eggs. Hash has green peppers and onions in it.

x2IGwMPke7IQRU-07TgAng.text: I love this place everyone is so nice and food is great.  The mini muffins are delicious, and the atmosphere is like your grandmother's kitchen.

v3mAhr24FCGtW72rLE1lHg.text: We stopped by around noon for a quick brunch and had a great experience. Our server, Missy, was fantastic and ever-attentive, always keeping our coffee full. I ordered the huevos rancheros which came with a basket of delicious muffins and home style potatoes. I thought the serving size was perfect; definitely enough to keep me sustained for awhile!  There were only two things that I was disappointed with: 1)my huevos rancheros were a bit bland and did not have much heat and 2) there was no free Wi-Fi as indicated on Yelp.

b0FmxLgqQhVprdedApqu5w.text: Good service and good food and, not always a long wait even when they are busy. They staff is also nice and hospitable

CEnOOity4XsfOxQ7U8cWow.text: It's pretty good. Best part of all: instead of bread they serve mini muffins!! Yes, it is annoying how small this place is and that you have to wait a while if it is busy to get a seat. Then once you are seated it feels quite crowded. The eggs are just ok. I much prefer the pancakes and sweeter side of the breakfast menu. It's not bad.

BdTfb97P0KcAwfmE6HQupw.text: Yummy Yummy Yummy!!! We found this place one Sunday while doing a google search because all of our regular places had too long of a wait and boy did we hit the jackpot! Very cozy local place with great service and good food! The staff is so friendly and nice and they truly care about how you are doing and how you like the food...such a nice change of pace. Meals come with a basket of mini muffins that are so good you'll have to be careful that you don't fill up before your meal comes out. I've had the Buttered Cinnamon Roll with Pecan's and I dream about it it's so good! Melts in your mouth, fresh and delicious :) I typically order the eggs benedict but we've tried the biscuits and gravy, pancakes and this past trip my friend had the crepes which were sensational!   A great little spot worth the wait when there is one!

dwZZxMCijG6AWHW5BPzHRg.text: Charismatic little diner with good service and good food & coffee. Will be back to keep enjoying a delicious fresh american breakfast menu. They were busy yet we sat down quickly and food came on time...

MZMWq0zWtSk5qWIXimWSBg.text: The food was good, but I am a stickler for good customer service. Unfortunately this place doesn't seem to have it, which is sad because it is very close to my work and we were looking for a good place to order our breakfast from in the mornings. The first time I went I was disappointed because I thought they delivered, but I chalked that up to a misunderstanding so no big deal. As I said they are very close to my job so picking up is not an issue. What was the issue is that when I arrived no one acknowledged me. There was someone there at the hostess desk that I was standing in front of, but she just stood there and kept doing what she was doing, no greeting or anything. Then she answered a call and took an order and then just walked away. I stood there for a little while until she came back and then acknowledged me. That rubbed me the wrong way, but again, I let it go because even though the restaurant wasn't busy at the time, doesn't mean they weren't busy with to go orders or something.  But today was the last straw, I called in to place another to go order so that my office could sample the lunch menu. The lady who answered the phone immediately asked if I could hold and I did for about 5 minutes and they hung up on me. This upset me, but I figured it was a mistake. So I called back and when the lady answered and asked what I would like to order. Before I placed my order I wanted to mention my issue with what had just happened. When I told her all I got was a kurt "sorry" and "you wanted to place a to go order right so what do you want". I decided not to place the order because I while I respect people in the service industry, I cannot respect or patron a restaurant whose staff has a complete disregard for its customers. Unacceptable.

dXiwQekFu102QgVe9BzG5g.text: Solid choice for breakfast in downtown Glendale.  Kiss the Cook has been around since I can remember and it was always a place my mom would take us for a girly breakfast or lunch. Once my dad caught on to the fluffiness of their omelets it became a family favorite.  It had been years since I had been back but the husband and I were in the mood for breakfast and since we are westsiders and slow to wake up on the weekend we knew we wouldn't be able to make it to the east valley to try something different.  Matt had never been to Kiss the Cook so it seemed like the perfect choice, the fact that there was a meat lover's omelet on special confirmed that choice. When he asked to sub the green onions in the omelet for something else, he was greeted with enthusiasm and encouragement from the waitress, "Yes! you are paying for it, might as well have something you like in it!"  This instantly won over my husband who often asks to sub or omit ingredients.  The baker's basket is a great touch and I have always had great friendly service. Our food came out promptly, fresh, and our drinks never ran dry. Best part we were in and out in 35 minutes which helped us still be able to enjoy a full day of errands, despite not rolling out of bed until 10am.

DVtvImWBNuJOwEv3iZZvgQ.text: Ok food. Pricing kind of high. Nothing special. Staff did not go out of their way to make you feel welcome. If Ian in the are I would go back. Not worth the drive from north side.

cvpdb2jcsF1_Db4sdw7K4g.text: Great service and the food was excellent.  Love the little muffins they were delicious.  Will be going back and it is nice they have outside setting so you can bring your dog.  Just need a better sign saying that you need to sign in for the waiting list.

gvaHOMCyX_72t4-tBNDJWA.text: This is one of my favorite breakfast places. We used to go here all the time when I was a kid. I remember always getting their chocolate chip pancakes. Yum! We moved away from the area and hadnt been in a while. We drove by the other day and decided to drop in. Its just as good as I remember. Those little mini muffins that come with your breakfast are amazing and there omelets are really good. I saw that their special was pumpkin pancakes and Im going to have to come back and try those. They also have a new flavored coffee everyday. Really good. I love the decor, its just as I remember it 20 years ago. Its a cute little family owned place where they remember your name. Love it. Ill definitely be going back.

u2ZJi92GR8L0kEDmsFXwTg.text: We happened to be in the Glendale this AM, and found this place on Yelp. It did not disappoint! They had fresh Hawaiian Hazelnut coffee, and we ordered a cinnamon roll to come out before the meal. Simply put, a slice of heaven...  The breakfast was also great, eggs, ham ,and biscuits and gravy, YEAH. I highly recommend this spot to anyone looking for a great breakfast in Glendale.

jaJHaeT4vy4_cfS99Skciw.text: Everything was made on the premises & you can really tell the difference! Excellent mini muffins (zucchini & pumpkin are my favs!) & really enjoyed the Garden Eggs Benedict (with mushrooms & spinach)! Country potatoes were very good too!

ZcruNdFtysdAIu916cZggQ.text: EXCELLENT and known for their PANCAKES!! Amazing! All breakfast items are very good including their omelettes. Don't go to a restaurant that specializes in breakfast and expect their lunch to be good. Went there one time for lunch and would've rather had a sandwich from a hospital cafeteria. Eight years of going there for breakfast. Great price and serving sizes.

znr_MTMMH3peVnhzM2S3ow.text: We use to come here for breakfast, they use have friendly staff but it's not the same anymore, not impressed what so ever.  But their food is still good.

SWpfavFu1BHcfW-_R0i6AA.text: I hit this place with the family one Sunday on the recommendation of an Internet article, naming it one of the top 9 breakfast spots in the area. It was ok, and probably rates somewhere in the middle of that list. The decor is sort of homey and random with a dash of countrification; we were seated on the patio at our request and received good, patient, attentive service. It won't break the bank to eat here, but everything is a la carte, so don't expect any sides to come with your meal. The beverages are overpriced for the amount given (almost $3 for a 12 ounce cup of fountain lemonade? half filled with ice? O_o) but the food was decent. It's a unique place but not special, if you get my drift. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again, but f you're in Glendale and have a hankering, give it a try.

hAYb0cduPPGsRa8V-9KGrg.text: Kiss the Cook is stellar in some ways and just misses the mark on others, which in my book rates it a solid four stars. I have been eating here since high-school and find this little family owned restaurant charming.  In addition to their regular menu (you can order breakfast or lunch any time), they always have three or four lovely specials. Generally, one is any omnivores dream, one takes fruit to a whole new level, and the other features one of their baked products done up to the nines.  My personal favorite is the "build your own" omelet. The ingredients are all super fresh, the omelet is always stuffed, and the house potatoes that are served on the side are very yummy (although I would like them done a little more on the crunchy side). My sisters favorite is the Snow Pea omelet. She swears it is the perfect combination of crunch and fluff!  Each meal starts out with a little basket of mini-muffin heaven. Alas the mini biscuits are no longer served, but man oh man are those zucchini muffins out of this world.  So you may be wondering, after all these raves, what are the down sides... well on occasion there is a little more butter on the bottom of the plate than I am comfortable with and although they are supposed to be famous, their sticky buns aren't all that special.  If you are looking for decent food, served with a smile, in a unique environment - you will definitely enjoy your visit to Kiss the Cook. Oh and there is that little chocolate kiss that leaves you wanting more...  : )

dd93pzdlrrusLMl2_VtQXQ.text: First time I have been there in years. My breakfast was pretty good and reasonably priced. Coffee was great with Sugar in the Raw (a great condiment). The pecan cinnamon roll was very yummy. We were there at 11:45am and were seated right away, drinks delivered, order taken, and food delivered within minutes. Overall...Thumbs Up!

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Kiss the Cook

9G8lF9Uy8-6DDNElnzwvHA.text: We weren't in the mood to go to some boring chain and we weren't having a whole lot of luck searching for breakfast places because we had already been to most of them.  After getting a little deeper in the search, the husband suggested this place.    I was immediately surprised when we walked in by the sheer amount of tables and chairs they managed to pack into this tiny little restaurant.  This is definitely not a place to come and eat if you have personal space issues.  While it was extremely busy inside we were immediately seated at a tiny table for two and greeted by a sweet lady named Sue.  I ordered the Country Breakfast with Bacon so I could try a little of everything that this place had to offer.  My meal came with 2 eggs, bacon, biscuits and gravy, fried potatoes, and the awesome little muffin basket everyone has talked about.  The little muffin basket served pre-meal like bread at an Italian restaurant is why I give this place 4 stars instead of just 3.  Everything else was average but good.  The prices were fair, the amount of food was plentiful, and the service was quick and friendly.  I could definitely see myself coming back here if I am in this part of town.

dSwDqdyJfmTBTlJxbyvZTQ.text: Great little spot in Glendale!  If you hadn't noticed, the West side (make that all sides...) is a strip mall wonderland.  When I got to Kiss the Cook, I was pleasantly pleased to see that it was a free standing building (guess I'm easily impressed) with plenty of parking and even a cute patio!  The menu was full of typical breakfast favorites including omelets, pancakes, and hearty breakfast indulgences.    5-star service!  Our coffee was never low and our water glasses were always replenished.  The decor inside was similar to my Michigan grandma's basement which made everything seem extremely relaxed.  As other Yelpers noted, the muffin basket is a highlight.  Once you order you are greeted with a little warm basket with several different types of miniature muffins of love.  mmm  I love that when you get your bill (cheap too by the way!), you are greeted with a real Hershey's kiss!  These are the touches that are always forgotten with chain restaurants  I know I will return- totally worth a try if you are on this side of town

WfmHF3VH6A48zRgCqDeFMg.text: As I write this review, I'm trying to think why I wouldn't give this place 5 stars. Today was my first time visiting this restaurant which is conveniently located less than a mile from my new beau's home. So we'll start with four stars until I have at least 5 visits under my culinary belt.  In the 9 and 3/4 years that I have resided in Arizona, for the first time, I have found a breakfast place I can call "home".  Let me start with the bacon.   When I ponder going vegetarian, I am only halted from executing said diet merely because there is no way on Mother Nature's Great Green Earth that I could/should/would ever give up my beloved pork strip. All bacon is not created equal but KTC has found one of the blessed thick cut smoked bacon brands that surpass most. (Costco has a great maple bacon from Canada if you trust my bacon expertise) I and my table mates were pleased.  We all ordered the day's special: Thick-cut bacon, eggs & potato cakes($7.45). Yummers! My love ordered an additional order of french toast ($4.50) with blueberries ($1.50) which he generously shared with I and his brother.  The baby-sized muffins were a nice, tasty, fresh-tasting start and didn't ruin my appetite for the main meal.  There were fresh flowers on the tables which I think is a great homey touch. The food presentation was visually pleasing. The orange juice ($2.25, large) was fresh and pulpy just like I like it. If it wasn't fresh squeezed it certainly tasted that way.  I didn't order coffee cause it was "see-through" and I like it dark & strong.  I agree with one of the other posters that the food is hella fresh tasting and this is what separates it from any of the pathetic chain restaurants its been compared to. (Incidentally, if Denny's is a place you frequent, that shit should have tasted like manna from the Heavens for you).  Did you ever have bacon & eggs that tasted like old recycled lard? Ick. That's what's missing here and that's what makes Kiss The Cook special.  The service was awesome. The staff are friendly and humorous.  The decor is country cute and mismatched as one poster pointed out which lends to its grandmotherly charm.  You get a "kiss" with your bill.  Actually, I just realized, that I would give this place 5 stars if it used Organic ingredients sourced mostly from Local Farms. That can be hard when the meals you offer do not have ingredients that are available locally.  If your palate longs for breakfast food made with "Love" and flavor, support Local Arizona small business and try Kiss the Cook!

T5NkTpL2meOnj8mM2p6VCA.text: Food is always good, but it can vary greatly by how good your waitress is. Also, if you order green chiles on an omelet it comes as a whole one on top--not diced as a stuffing inside. The baker's basket of mini-muffins is always great, but it would be nice to get an occasional blueberry one (they always seem to run out way too early).

McPI2oo7vmOj98p90k4UUQ.text: Very cute and cozy. Perfect for Breakfast on a Sunday morning. Prices are affordable and the quality of the food was great. Will definitely be back!

dnRsNbHFVSrOtc8OzaTwIw.text: Waitress was extremely friendly, service was excellent. We were seated immediately, the dining area is small but not crowded, very cozy. Drink order was taken as soon as we were seated. Special of the day was shared when we were served our drinks. Muffin basket came out very hot with a nice variety of mini muffins and butter. Seasonal mini plates were provided for our muffins. Mine was a really cute Santa. My sister had a snowman. Order was taken and served in a very timely manner. Waitress kept our drinks hot and full. Serving portions were perfect, not too much/not too little. Our comfort and needs were a priority.

3B3sLNImuoCKjIuB726zFw.text: Excellent place for breakfast! From the hostess to the wait staff they make you feel right at home! The food is fantastic and if you want to substitute something it's fine with them. Mom and I keep going back. Try it you'll find a new eatery...

X-i0XFkuar4RB1bnqEkhlA.text: Adorable and delicious diner that is such a delight. The food is scrumptious and the staff is warm and it feels like home. I will definitely be back when I come through the area.

n7y74aOrvlzhPh8P8bkv2g.text: Food was average.  Service was friendly but bad. Multiple small mistakes.  They changed the special after I ordered (steak to chicken) but never told me about it until I complained., no apology was offered.

px5nOn5s5NOnb34vfNSYfw.text: I've been here a couple times whenever I visit Arizona. Out of all the places I've been to, this joint stood out the most! It's probably because of their wonderful basket of delicious mini muffins! I seriously loved all of them and could have finished a whole basket by myself easily! They had lemon poppy, pistachio, and cinnamon? I think.  The first 2 were my favs.   Service It wasn't super busy when we came, which was a Saturday afternoon around 12. The waiter that took our order was really nice and funny! I forgot his name.. He was also really attentive so thank you for that! He refilled our water without us asking, checked up on us, cracked a couple jokes. It was nice for us out of town people.   Food You MUST get the Cajun eggs Benedict. It's the right amount of spicy, and was super amazing!  Biscuits and gravy- it didn't have any sausage and was okay... I didn't really care for it.  Yogurt parfait- loved the fruits and yogurt! Really refreshing.  Pecan pancake? I forgot the name. It was drowned in some sweet liquid/syrup. I had a bite and it was Waaaay too sweet for me and I love sweet! Maybe better for dessert rather than breakfast/brunch.   Super cheap for 6 people compared to Cali! It was $60 without tip... Well worth the money!

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Cajun eggs Benedict! So yummy!

g-Tj8tBauydU_cGmbdmqcQ.text: It's Saturday, mid-morning. You just woke up, your stomach is rumbling, and you decide that you're in the mood to go out for some brunch. Somewhere with a typical diner menu like Denny's, Waffle House, or IHOP would probably be good, but you're wanting to try something new. You're craving that warm comfort of a mom-and-pop diner that you just don't get at a chain restaurant. Look no further, because Kiss the Cook fits the bill! Kiss the Cook is a classic, eclectic restaurant near downtown Glendale that offers great food, a unique environment, and even better service. Winning the award for best breakfast from the popular and respected "Phoenix New Times" magazine on more than one occasion, Kiss the Cook is a restaurant that will have you coming back to satisfy your hunger many Saturdays to come.

azs9v7J9bd6n7zT2iE2nNg.text: Great service, fun atmosphere, awesome food, decor is fun and the entire place reminds me of a comfy morning at grandma's house..... but with even better food! If you go on a Saturday or Sunday make sure to arrive early!! They have a lot of "regulars" that make the experience even better!!

iTkSZa9CbEhCdJf7KH8Yqw.text: My husband and I always drove by this place and always wanted to try it well today we did and we will be back again! Welcoming staff with amazing service!  The mini muffins are great the waffle and eggs were perfect it was all around great! Keep up the good work!

XvAdt9J_xdYLe7-qVnGUVg.text: Love their home like feel to their restaurant. Something bout their muffins and coffee make my mouth water. I'm up and out early every morning so their early opening time is wonderful for me. The only thing that is disappointing is the lack of space between seats and tables. It's very crammed. I've still come back though.

YgalJbRg0EiveeEARpbpVQ.text: Super cute restaurant with great food and service. Will go again if ever in town again.

The sausage and bacon are also delicious and so are the home fries.   You can't go wrong with this place for breakfast if you're on the westside but it's also popular so be prepared to wait.

in8ZMjOJIu4rLX0OPFENRA.text: Delicious country sausage gravy! Probably the best I've had! Tastes just like Grandmas homemade! Great service and a very friendly family feel for breakfast! Kids enjoyed every bite! Will definitely return for breakfast!

NqCRIosVtspKmLAA0-rJUA.text: Our friends took us here for breakfast and wow they picked a winner. The food, no matter what you get is all out of this world!  They will let you know they fear the lightrail expansion though.

cAmku33pp5c66_ZNuKyBZA.text: Yeah, this place is awesome. I had a combo eggs and pancake and their pecan roll. It's all awesome. Super fresh tasting and just really, really good. Pancake is light, pecan roll is pretty divine. People who work there are pretty friendly too. Would definitely come back and bring a morning date too.

Dv0_z7MwaNvOsRGFjjxxDA.text: man what to say about this place the little muffins are good hot bought some to take home but so good when there not hot order omelette and waffle start of with waffle it was a little bland just OK  now the omelet there was just something not good not sure but they could of been eggs from a carton the potato's that come with the eggs tasted boiled or freezer burn the server is what made it 3 stars she saved the day will come back and try lunch
