q7_md0n7tXfFRETOL_VqPg.text: I know I seem like a crazy person who can't make up my mind on this restaurant, but I think I'm done with it. Went here a few more times in the last 6 months or so, the eggs florentine went south.... eggs not cooked correctly, hollandaise was gluey... produce not so fresh. Went last weekend, got two eggs and bacon with potatoes. The eggs were cooked well but flavorless... the whole plate was flavorless. I broke up pieces of bacon and mixed it with the potatoes and put the eggs on top.... still not good. The potatoes were undercooked, crunchy still, and had no seasoning whatsoever, it was just a bland pile of grease... yuck. On top of that, we waited over 30 minutes for a table. I don't think I'll be back, there are too many good breakfast places around to continue to go to a bad one.  PS The service here continues to be very friendly, so that is a plus.

ysk0xVOS17cjGHClLU8Xng.text: AWESOME!! Pros Service was unbeatable! Super friendly! Food was great with good portions. Prices are fairly inexpensive.  Cons A lot of decor on the wall   Overall awesome experience!

RjMZsnzo21ZiAbT6sBtXhA.text: This had been on my saved list for quite some time. The staff was very friendly and I love the random decor. Mismatched chairs (intentional) and fun interior. Coffee was hot and fresh. Mini muffin basket was a great because while I like to have a savory breakfast most of the time I always want a little something sweet in there, but I don't want a whole side of pancakes or French toast. So this was nice. They weren't amazing muffins, but they were all I needed. Breakfast came out fast. I like more unique options on the menu. My husband got the new Orleans omelet and that was delicious. I had the omelet that was in special. They were both Uber fluffy, cheesy and delicious. The home fries were also seasoned well and very tasty.. No bland potatoes here. Overall I would say a 3.5 but that's not an option in here. If I was in the area I would go back in a heartbeat, but I wouldn't make a trek across the city for it.

NDx8hEfJKRUNK3RZKecTiQ.text: This is a wonderful family restaurant. The food is delicious, fresh and hot. It's comfort food with nice size servings. My husband, son and I ate breakfast/lunch there today. Our waitress was warm and friendly. She was kind, welcoming and service was outstanding. I ordered the seafood omelette with home fried potatoes and vanilla flavored coffee. My husband ordered the corned beef hash, fried eggs and home fried potatoes with coffee.  My son ordered the special: chicken sliders with potato chips. Our friendly waitress brought us a hot from the oven basket of mini muffins.  It was a treat to eat here and we will be back. I loved the restaurant and dining area--it's very quaint and comfortable.

xJ6ulOgtgdBZQI18h5Eq6Q.text: What's not to love about this cozy place. Service is fantastic, every person working here is super friendly and makes you feel welcomed. They bring out these tasty little muffins with butter for you as soon as you sit down, and trust me, you can't eat just one. As far as food goes, you can't beat the freshness of everything they bring out, not the incredible taste. My husband and I shared Cajun Benedict and the Cooks combo with thick bacon and chocolate chip pancakes, needless to say, there were no leftovers.  Stop by this place, you won't be disappointed.

OT8npQABeOPQjHL_b1rS0A.text: Great place to have breakfast. Very friendly Michelle was my waitress super attentive and the food was excellent. The French toast with a side of sausage and coffee was perfect, the French toast was probably the best I've had in a long time if not ever.

xTyIqpcFfgzepVPVm9keOw.text: Hi,  I will admit the name was what enticed me to visit Kiss the cook. I am sure I am not the only one who has done this. Anyhow, upon walking in I really liked the cozy ambience. The waitresses all have that mom-like-feel. What is that you ask? They were all aged enough to be my mom. Super adorable and sweet. I felt so catered to and loved on by complete strange older woman.   As for the food; Menu is very simple and pretty much comfort food or anything that will fill you up and make you feel like a stuffed sausage. Upon being seated you are greeted with a smile and a basket filled with their house muffins. I ate one or five. I cant remember, but they were warm, moist and delicious. Overall, portions are very generous. Food had great flavor.   It's pretty easy. If you want a good breakfast or lunch and you are in the area this is definitely a place to visit. They have an outdoor pet friendly area, spacious indoor seating and a wonderful vibe.  Oh, and when you are provided with the check, you are given "kisses" Hershey Kisses.   Great for a meet up with friends, family or solo date.   XOXO B

SpL78nyMvznMGunri2CnHA.text: We stopped by after the swap meet. I had the French toast and pecan caramel cinnamon roll. Both were excellent. They also give you a basket of mini muffins which were also excellent. I highly recommend.

634LiYY7upkOZHbeObYkKA.text: This place is Amazing! We were looking for a breakfast place and stumbled across it. What a delightful surprise. The food is outstanding and large portions. The service was incredible, we felt like we were family from the start. Put this one on your list of must tries!

49_E9MqOArym6_UdN9eQxw.text: Had breakfast here Saturday morning for the first time! I can't believe this was my first time, it definitely will not be my last. The line was long but the hostess was wonderful and they did not hesitate to get you in a table as sol. As it cleared. They also have coffee while you wait. The server was wonderful and their special sweet cream coffee was perfect after the wait. The food was out quickly and did not disappoint! I had the Cajun Benedict's and they were delicious. Oh did I mention the bring our muffins to your table?! This place was so cute and I can't wait to come back!

uVkIvMjwZ1vz_c5_x9ELqQ.text: Great food and service!! Very deserving of a 5 star rating. Some additional feedback is to have alternatives to dairy like almond milk or skim. I would have enjoyed my coffee more with some almond milk.

JxyMinqN_7W4Y70i94D5zA.text: The atmosphere was okay, but the food 2as pretty good. We were seated rather quickly considering it was Easter Sunday. The cinnamon coffee was pretty good; went well with the famous muffins.

7c8Y-KpQZPh5CKEuCjWP3g.text: This place was around the corner from me and I HATED it, I craved their buttermilk pancakes, although everything is good here my go-to meal has always been The Cook's Combo.  I hope Guy (of Diner, Drive-Ins and Dives) never finds out about this place, it would be impossible for us "regular" folks to get a seat if he does.

rXWdBQw-suEc3SAvw92cJg.text: I can go anywhere I want to eat breakfast and unfortunately I chose Kiss the Cook this morning.  Coffee was awful.  Waited a long, long time for our food which was delivered cold.  I don't ever send anything back to the kitchen.  I also don't go back to a restaurant for bad service and cold food.  As the waitress was profusely apologizing and taking ownership that she dropped the ball regarding our breakfast, her cell phone rang loudly from her waitress apron which clarified her priorities at her job.  I won't sign their petition to prevent the light rail from coming to downtown Glendale.  We deserve better options for dining In Glendale.  The waitress wasn't some clueless teenager, she simply sucks at her job.

pZeJgLoFE6tOmh2sH8iRTw.text: This place is wonderful. Everything I have gotten there is wonderful. Their omelettes are huge. I've had the Cajun, and pulled pork which is awesome. I've also had the Cajun style eggs Benedict. Everything I've ordered has come with a basket of mini muffins. Make sure to try their cinnamon pecan roll, my wife and I usually share one. The service is sometimes a little slow, but with good food, who really cares. Next time your debating between one of those chain restaurants and this place for breakfast, go here.

cuH-Ozm8hHSWug2H19D2kA.text: Delicious coffee the food is good especially the eggs benedict place is always clean and friendly can't go wrong with the muffins also

WpyFPz-Vc06LqJgj_NSDCw.text: Poor service and food was mediocre at best. The side of potato was about the only thing I ate that was good and they show no love to veterans or military families.

EK_dq1N_7mqaHGlbVszyIw.text: Good breakfast place. Can't believe I hadn't been here after living in the neighborhood so long. I enjoyed the laid back feeling of the homey decore and really appreciated the peace and quiet of this restaurant compared to a lot of the obnoxiously loud and chaotic breakfast spots out there. My wife and I had their flavored coffee, on this day it happened to be a Hawaiian hazelnut which I really enjoyed. The mini muffins and butter were a nice touch and were just enough to not take away from the breakfast entrees. My review would have been 4 stars, but while ordering I asked our server if the corn beef hash was made in house which she said it was turned out to be canned. Not terrible, the meal was still good, but had I been informed properlyI would have ordered differently. Service was great otherwise and I will definitely return to try the New Orleans omelet with Cajun hollandaise. The description looked really good so I'll look forward to that upon my return.

u8EC3ocH0e0yxoOgZIlIbg.text: Went there for a nice Easter breakfast an the food was cold an the bacon was burnt would not tell my friends

VenNpc0KFQNqsg8RoYMfsw.text: I really wanted to like this place to support local small businesses...however, the food was not all that exciting.  The best part of the meal were the mini-muffins.  It went downhill after that.  I ordered the Cajun eggs Benedict.  The eggs were cooked nicely but the Cajun sauce just didn't taste right.  When I was in NOLA the sauce had a much better flavor and depth.  This one missed the spot.  The kielbasa tasted more like hot dogs.   Sad to say, if it weren't for the muffins, I would have only given 1 star.  The mini muffins are worth a trip but that's it.

aQQYuzf3US5Dp7ZldLDbvg.text: Came for a friends birthday and had a great time. Nicole was a fantastic server and even got the whole restaurant to sing happy birthday to the birthday girl. Food was great and will definetly be back.

wpWi0JvNlMuDjtd05fKTHg.text: This rather seedy restaurant makes up for it in friendly good natured staff and delicious (breakfast) food. Have only eaten here twice, as a once-a-Year snowbird, and both experiences were very positive. The special this year was Cajun omelette which was indeed special, and the veggie eggs Benedict delivered. Don't wonder why you came, just salivate in anticipation!

w2GAQockmnlYpP9iGiUaLw.text: Good ole fashioned homestyle cooking, friendly staff, good prices, try the muffins, you'll love em!

cWxeyjzsH9MabhE1oaX7FQ.text: This place has a back woods diner kind of feel, It's cute! But the food is nothing special. Muffins we pretty good though...

ucZXJ_Op9d0CTjH3zx8E9A.text: Food is very fresh especially the fruit. Was surprised the menu said seasonal fruit and they actually brought out seasonal fruit and it was fresh. Watermelon.... Yum everything else was standard. I had an omelet with tomato, broccoli and light cheese. Delicious! And a Belgium Waffle which was nice and fluffy. I could only eat half of everything but it was delicious. I didn't have any protein but I had my Shakeology this morning No Worries. Www.shakeology.com/msjet... Will be back!

Rkq9Noa214cbMLkc9Ym2YA.text: I have now been here 3 times.  This place is sort of an icon in Glendale and I had been hearing that I had to go here since I moved here 17 years ago.  The first time I was here was Mothers Day. and I ordered the special breakfast of chicken crepes with a fruit bowl.  It was cold, the spinach had the texture of shoe leather, the Alfredo sauce had separated then formed a skin.  The fruit bowl it came with was ok as was the coffee and the mini muffins with butter were really good.'  The next time I went for lunch and had that day's special which was a  hot turkey sandwich with potato salad.  The sandwich was ok. The potato salad was bland but the seasoned salt on the table made it ok.   This last time I had the Cooks breakfast of two pancakes, two eggs, two sausages (or bacon) and I added some potatoes.  The breakfast was lukewarm.  The pancakes and potatoes were pretty good, the eggs and sausage were just ok.  As noted before the mini muffins served with real butter were really good.  Ever body I encountered was pleasant.  The place is looking a bit worn.  When I was there the place was one to two thirds full.  I noticed this last trip the line of chairs and the coffee station outside were missing.  I fully understand that the banter between the waitresses and the regular customers is one of the things that brings people back, I just wish it didn't cause my food to be served lukewarm as I saw other plates served that were still steaming.  I gave it a 3 but it is a pretty weak 3 and although I would go there again if somebody else picked it I doubt it will make it into my regular rotation.

WCOYro3E9YE6HLppDkQT0w.text: Amazing words don't describe the food! First time here and it didn't disappoint. The restaurant is quaint and unique. None of the settings match, which adds to the appeal. Although the service wasn't the best, the restaurant was extremely busy and I think that has a lot to do with the quality of service we received. I recommend checking it out, it's well worth it.

Co2kPpLdpEWt7taRPY_hyA.text: I wanted to like this place, I really did. It's right up the street from me and I was hoping it could be my new breakfast spot I could do my work at. The decor is really cute and country. There population of customers were mostly elderly, getting the feeling they are regulars and have been coming to this spot for years. My server was friendly and prompt. I asked for suggestions and she gave me an idea on what is best here. The wifi wasn't accessible, they didn't have the password. I ordered the eggs Benedict. It was drenched in  sauce so so so bad the biscuit was soggy and I had a hard time distinguishing any other flavors outside the hollandaise sauce. I thought, well geez they just make it that way and then as I tried to stomach this dish noticed a lady next to me had ordered the same thing and hers was not swimming in hollandaise sauce. If my waitress had been paying attention maybe she could have prevented the order from coming out or if she would have taken some time to ask how everything was she could have learned about how displeasing this dish truly was.

B4GHzzFjGvMAG_8HyJhY-g.text: Still a good place to grab some brunch. Always a good special on the board to be had. Service is always good, even when the wait staff is curt. Forget 'Donnie's' up on Peoria and come here instead. True gem in Glendale.

sBeRZQ1yIRdLQS7JIPdegg.text: Had the meatloaf special, was very disappointed in the portion size, it was 1 very thin slice of meatloaf that fell a part and they put it back together on the plate. Maybe 4 bites.. My friend looked at it and was thinking the same thing I was... Got to be kidding me, it was very close to close, I think they should not of served it..

QTnQAY2UT2SMgJ2DJJXmPg.text: Horrible customer service.  The owner straight lied to us and blamed her waitress for something that was up to her. She actually tried to break down market prices of pork chops to us...wth???  The special of the day, which was on display on the front chalkboard sign, was a two pork chop breakfast for $11.95. I ordered that and was informed they only had one pork chop left. I told them I would take the one and our party  (6) all ordered.  Our food was blah, as was the coffee. When our check arrived I was charged for a different breakfast ($10.95)plus a side meat of 1 pork chop ($7)!! When we pointed out how this didn't make sense the owner told us since we didn't get the 2 pork chops we were charged market price for 1. We pointed out the sign and were told it didn't apply even though it fell on them. She had the nerve to remove 40 cents from the bill. This was the most insulting dining experience of my life.

F-pNqtPhVZjEYNCAOSv_1A.text: First time here and I will definitely be back! The food of course was amazing but what really made me want to leave a review was the service. Our waitress never let our coffee go half below and was very very sweet! And yes, those muffins!!!! Yum!

wKU85bnsjLhBEoOf3nAGig.text: This was a wonderful find in Glendale AZ. Do yourself right by dining at this small but "big diner. We had the biscuits and gravy, the food was homemade and the service was grand.

beKlUgjUu8iy_2wx4aiPtw.text: Amazing pancakes and great eggs . We eat at a lot of breakfast places and we believe a pancake should stand alone without syrup ! Their pancakes didn't disappoint

8nNI2E_rytPpLjdbA9vfjA.text: Every meal comes with a kiss, we were informed shortly after sitting down. I was going to ask if we had to cook our own food or how that whole thing worked out, but didn't.  KTC was a solid 3 stars for our breakfast this morning. I ordered the Canjun Bene; Paul, the Belgian waffle; and Jason, the biscuits and gravy. Three orders of mini muffins arrived shortly thereafter, with real butter and apple butter that was at the table. As others have stated, the muffins were great. Our meals arrived in a timely manner and we all dug in. Paul polished off his waffle promptly while Jason and I slowly enjoyed our meals. I honestly have to say I wish I didn't eat so many muffins because I wasn't able to finish my eggs, which were wonderful. The creole seasoning added to the Hollandaise sauce added a terrific flavor and just a little heat.  The decor made me feel like I was back home in Northwest Ohio. That doesn't add the the appeal for me, but some enjoy those things.  While service during our meal was attentive (I drink a lot of water during a meal and their glasses were pretty small, but I was refilled several times). However, after our plates were cleared, we sat around for almost ten minutes before we could flag down our server for the bill. Which was when we also received our kisses. Hershey's Kisses. Cute, but I rarely eat candy. Still, cute.

7k1NVvW9dzl725-CEbbExw.text: Great food! Good service and love the decor....  So cute! I'll be back for the Cajun Eggs Benedict!!

h5vV9kGtSqzfuqGRvDC2ow.text: Great Food & Great Service all for the Perfect Price.  Kiss the Cook offers you the small town feel of your local breakfast cafe but with this country hospitality through the nick-knacks and woven baskets for sell. The menu offers the basics of any small town brunch style restaurant and for the quality, I'd say the price is unbeatable. One of their trademarks seems to be their small muffins, and I'll admit they are pretty darn good! Not the only thing I'd come here for by any means but defiantly never have a problem eating the ones they sit in front of me ;)  One thing to keep caution for is the wait. The parking lot is rather small and the restaurant is much smaller.. so even on a typical weekday for brunch you'll find yourself waiting 30 minutes or longer

06jmM_gZkFYbFkmRJ-6imQ.text: Fantastic little breakfast place! Great food! Mostly great service! If you want a locally owned and operated breakfast tradition, this is the place!

Nothing too crazy. Portion size is very generous! I got the make your own omelette for $9.50 then the rest of the toppings are $.50 each. Prices are good! My friend got waffles combo for $9.25. Dnxv4JrEl1oJ8R5leThrfg.text: Our first time here. After watching check please Arizona on PBS I thought I would give it a try. Had the New Orleans Cajun Omelette accompanied with grandmas fried potatoes. It was outstanding!  A cute, antique-cluttered restaurant offering the west side commendable breakfasts and lunches.  Sandwiches, which are served in bags can be accompanied by homemade soups, salads and desserts. Earlier in the day, we love the French toast. And most entrees come with a cute little basket holding a variety of tasty mini-muffins. It's that kind of extra touch that truly makes you feel good.  Definitely will come back looking to try the Eggs Benedict cajun style.

yZXy2zfIDCid60L7VcEhXw.text: Been coming here since 2009.. never let's me down. Love the cajun omelet. Highly recommend it .   Especially the muffins they give you when your waiting for your food. Delicious.   My rating here.   Food 10 Atmosphere 10 Customer service 10  Highly recommend this place.

4gwX4LU_wlZHr194lQfn7w.text: I really enjoyed this place. Our server was really nice and was willing to accommodate kids menu if I needed help. My husband ordered the New Orleans Cajun omelet and I ordered the Cook's combo.  My husband loved the omelet, he said it was spicy and had a lot of flavors. Mine was pretty plain but delicious.  The only thing we didn't like was the potatoes. But we can't quite place what's wrong them. They seemed undercooked. But overall, it's like going to grandma's house for breakfast with a lot of people there.  Good experience and good food. And also the muffins were delicious :) We'll be back!

AdddqhoiNJL2YCYkP23Lvg.text: Next time you are in Glendale for breakfast or lunch, PLEASE visit Kiss the Cook. I have never had a better experience with a server than I did with Susan. The place is homey, and everything is cooked home style. Serving was massive. No cans, no bs. I was welcomed like family, even though when I first looked in, I thought I was in the wrong place. The crowd gets more mixed as the day progresses, and often has a wait on weekends. I really can't stress enough how great Ms. Susan was. She even took a customer's food to warm It up because he was away from his table for a few minutes. The man never asked. She ran up to the cashier and told the staff my name and where I was from. If she wants another grandson, she can have me!

zoEnJ6UgpnUsjNAalKAJvQ.text: This is personally my favorite breakfast restaurant in Glendale. I can sit here and tell you about how good there pancakes are or how the biscuits and gravy is too die for which it is but I wanna tell y'all about the Cajun Benedict! The poached eggs are made to perfection, the spicy hollandaise sauce is mouth watering and is the main reason why I get it. I recommend you try the Cajun Benedict or if you're not in the mood for alittle kick you'll be good just ordering the regular eggs Benedict. Ps the muffins they bring out to you before your meal are just the tastiest little things ever.  Can't wait to go back.

6f_n0_s4fRN-Rvj3dbm89Q.text: It is really hard to find a good brunch place in Glendale. I am really glad that I found this place. It is my favorite spot to go when I'm in Glendale. I love their muffins. They are so soft. I got the omelette and it is soooo good. The egg is fluffy and soft. They also have great service. I highly recommend this place!

kGKNAWmnIJH4c42KrADD2w.text: Perfect atmosphere for a relaxing breakfast/ brunch. Staff was very polite and kind. Thoroughly enjoyed (:

zbuIgO4YDNZbK_q5WEPnHQ.text: Very cozy and tasty food. The place is pretty small and the wait time can be a little while, but the service is superb and our waitress was super friendly. A quaint and homely place to eat at.

3Q1Mk1SWqzHr-5PG2Hng6g.text: When in Phoenix this is a must stop for Breakfast.  Get here early though, the place is busy.  If you like eggs Benedict . The Cajun eggs Benedict are to die for.  No matter what you order you will not be disappointed. The fresh hot muffins  they bring before your breakfast comes are amazing.

xtlc-b-KbRMHvtGi_9mZXw.text: The environment is really cute. The chairs and dishes are all different, which I just love. The options are really good on the menu. I got the Country Breakfast and liked it a lot.  The potatoes could have more flavor, but we're good when mixed in the gravy. The mini muffins are so cute and very good. The employees are all very friendly. The water is also good. I typically don't drink water at restaurants because it tastes like toilet water, but Kiss the Cook has good water.

pCCq1NdSlLyd7liZjucITQ.text: Good breakfast, not expensive. First time there and I will go back. Breakfast was big and coffee was good.

HYRWWT3BKMr-lhPRkHkzjQ.text: This place is just so good! We used to go to the Good Egg but since we had a bad encounter with a very rude server we haven't brought ourselves to go back.   We get stuck in routines when it comes to restaurant so finding a new breakfast joint seemed like it would take forever. I binged and found Kiss the Cook. It is kind of a drive for us but I have been wanting to try something new.   The outside doesn't appear to be anything special but I was wrong. The inside of the place is just gorgeous. I love all the many different tables and chairs and even those fluffy little cat miniature figurines. The servers are pleasant and quick and I have no complaints so far.   The food is delicious! Great big helpings and it isn't greasy! My daughter and I almost always devour the scrumptious muffins but we try to refrain ourselves in order to save room for our food which is delicious.   Definitely worth a try. Great service, atmosphere, and above all a great breakfast!

2lr0_MLkPtbRm3zwokalVA.text: This is a True home town favorite. I have been going here ever since I was a little girl. The food here is delicious and has the real home cooked style, the little bran muffins are my favorite! I really feel at home when eating here! Especially with all the mix matched dishes :)

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States

dci6hvsxHq3EtAsLoF4AvQ.text: Kiss the Cook is ok place to eat. Nothing fancy but the atmosphere is cozy. This restaurants plates, glasses, chairs, etc don't match each other and this gives it a homey feel. There is usually a waiting line to get a seat mainly because the restaurant isn't too big. The food is ok just not my type of breakfast food.

D326M2keRDzlL1q7kGqwNg.text: Excellent!  Superb service and wonderful food. We discovered this place about 5 years ago but had never ate lunch there always  breakfast. The lunch is every bit as good as the breakfast. This is a must do every time we are in the Phoenix area.

_5jjRQSVEJitjI2DSty-NQ.text: Another great Yelp discovery! We were looking for a breakfast place within easy driving distance of the stadium and thought we'd give Kiss The Cook a try. Super homey little restaurant with tons of nick nacks on the walls. Not in a corporate chain kind of way but in a grandma's house if your grandmother was a bit of a hoarder way. It was all very cute. Although the place was packed we only had to wait a few minutes for a table. The waitress was incredibly nice and efficient. Everything on the menu looked appetizing. I settled on the special of pork chops and eggs, the pork chop was really well seasoned. The coffee was even good. I find most restaurant coffee to be too weak but it was just about perfect. Also I should add that they gave us a basket of freshly baked mini muffins for an appetizer. Any place that does that is okay by me.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Coffee at Kiss The Cook

EOjgiBdg0PeE6yKj5OYm6Q.text: This place was so delicious!! My husband ordered one of their cinnamon rolls which was absolutely fantastic. I ordered the French toast which was amazing as well. Their coffee was great, too. They served us a small basket of mini muffins to start which were hot and fresh out of the oven. Such a great atmosphere and the service was great although a little slow. Would definitely recommend otherwise!

JSUJu74ZJZkm2ZuCyXL3KA.text: I Love omelett And this place Is one OF the best omelletes, todays special Is Good. this place is amazing from the customer service  and food

5a48f9wYizHXa4VYv8fFDg.text: Great value and service, all the staff were very sweet. Food was just okay - I got the pancakes and they were a little raw in the middle and burnt on the outside. Probably best thing were the breakfast potatoes but nothing else really stood out.

ac-NxGkfGxwfSFJBr4XSXg.text: Always great breakfast!  The chocolate chip pancakes are amazing and the muffins are spectacular!

mVjlJ4q9cLdCM4rugMaY9Q.text: This is a good place to grab a nice quiet breakfast. Tried it for the first time last weekend. The price is fair, spent about $25 after tip for two of us. The food was delicious. The service was good. Had a ten minute wait to be seated at 11AM on a Sunday.  Our waiter kept our drinks refilled. Unfortunately their cups are so small that I required 4 refills, but I never felt neglected. Honestly the small cup thing scared me, that had real potential to screw up my meal if they weren't paying attention...but they were so it's all good.  I had a real generic breakfast of eggs, bacon, pancakes, and a side of toast. It was all very good. I paid the extra $1 for "thick" bacon, and that was totally worth it. My girl got cornbeef hash and eggs, and she thought it was very good.  Next time I probably will try the "New Orleans Omelet". Sounded good, but at a new place I usually go generic to test the water, and get fancy my 2nd go around.   Impressive breakfast, I probably would've kissed that cook.

Qhj0hvv4Qq-ZBvm0pTIdtQ.text: Cozy and comfortable with eclectic mismatched tables and chairs and lots of interesting decor on the walls.  Went for a late breakfast when we flew in from the Midwest to see my 92y/o mother who was visiting my brother.  Definitely a better choice than visiting her in Buffalo, NY this time of year.  Independent diner with great omelette choices, especially the Jalapeno & cheese, as well as traditional breakfast choices (Eggs Benedict).  OMG!!!  Added to the muffin basket, you've amped the comfort food level to the stratosphere (in addition to excellent handicapped accessibility).

qEyjN882-BfK1zK3xO04DA.text: The country plate taste excellent with great flavor and plenty of food. Great prices for what you're getting. Waitresses were all pleasant and attentive. Only bad thing we experienced at the time was the ranchero sauce sucks.

u_6BlfoUcl5QhfM51yWAvQ.text: Shaded dog friendly patio with a nice clean water bowl!  I would come again just for that, but the food and service was great too.

CVa3VhLUj3O_0QuvnUlQ-A.text: If you're ever in Glendale and you need to come to a breakfast spot this is the place it has a very charming feel. The menu is small but most of the things are good.

HlBbqYl4kZH5OMPlv1BgCA.text: This is my new favorite breakfast/brunch place! Their Cajun style Benedict is amazing, the sauce is good and spicy! They offer a daily flavored coffee and give you a basket of mini muffins to munch on while you wait for your meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Basket of mini muffins while you wait on your meal! Delicious!

7bWKrlcC1XJ2KNr00KpIig.text: This is definitely my new favorite breakfast spot. The service is absolutely wonderful and the decor is the most quaint thing I have seen! They start you off with fresh mini muffins - bran and zucchini walnut and they just melt in your mouth with the butter spread on the warm muffin.  Had the special of the day - omelet with swiss cheese, ham, spinach and garlic and oh my goodness was it delicious.  We ordered a cinnamon bun to share and it was so yummy, covered in caramel (but not too sweet).  Definitely must go!

o8DLkJ1tktzflXy-VsPgEQ.text: It's such a cute little place with amazing food. Unique little concepts too. Give it a try

L7QdB2bcR7ZRSiCfT7itZg.text: Fantastic little place. I had the create your own omelet and it was huge and very delicious! The mini muffins they give you are full of flavor. Ours were zucchini and I couldn't stop eating them. The crispy potatoes they came with my meal were some of the best taters I've ever had. I loved how crispy they were. I got a side of the Cajun hollandaise sauce and omg it was incredible! I was dipping everything in it. It's sooooo good. Good food, friendly staff, cute place. I will come back for sure next time I'm in town.

zPOZ8SqEzAqvhSH2GurKMw.text: This was my dad's go to breakfast place when he lived in this part of the Valley.   He loved all things breakfast there.. but especially eggs benedict.   When I went to visit, I always got an omelet. Huge and yummy.   Coffee? not bad. Not Portland, but not bad.

8qGWqyBq1SNjIBJdJiL5Wg.text: Yummy and cute place.  I am always on the look out for a good waffle and this place has it. Very delicious. The bacon is also yummy and the muffin basket is really cute.

Ck0z3buWh2sNDik3ZJwAlg.text: I don't know why I waited so long to try this place. It has everything you'd expect from a family owned breakfast joint. The menu consists of your usual breakfast combos, pancakes, omelets, waffles...the difference between this place and all the others, I felt was the service and the small details. Upon sitting down and getting water, they gave us a basket of homemade mini muffins. It was a variety of three - blueberry, zucchini and bran or spice. I was delightfully surprised at how delicious the cinnamon roll was. I wasn't sure if it was going to be too sweet like the ones you get at the mall. Nope, it was sweet enough and had just the right amount of cinnamon and sugar. I'd probably go back just for these alone! For breakfast I ordered the French toast but substituted the eggs for home fries (so good), and bacon. At the end of the meal they brought the check out with two Hershey kisses.So cute! I felt the service was great and will definitely be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Cinnamon roll
Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Hershey kisses
Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Mini muffin basket

WNZ41FHCKO0riiLz5Nuoug.text: Solid service and solid food.  The cinnamon pecan roll was an amazing start...but wait...they brought out mini-muffins too!  Coffee was nice, but came out in clear glasses and was very light.  Good taste, but I enjoy a more bold coffee (not as watered down).  I had eggs Benedict and it was standard...English muffin, ham, and poached egg with hollandaise sauce.  Standard, but standard is good.  Good flavor, fresh sauce and toasty bread.  Potatoes had a nice spice to them and burned on the edges...love that burned spice taste.  All in all, if you find yourself in Glendale, Kiss the Cook is a solid little place for breakfast.  I wanna try a pie!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Cinnamon Pecan Roll...yeah, that does it for me

dbcRr-FTyWfOXV8t1JOCuA.text: Very cute breakfast/lunch spot.  They were pretty busy and could have used a second server, but our server was great ... just busy.  She made good suggestions and knew her menu. It was awesome she brought out our homemade cinnamon roll first all warmed up.  It was very very good, especially the sauce!  The muffins ... I can't say enough about the mini muffins!  Super good ... make sure to order a dish that includes them!  The eggs Benedict had good taste with fresh sauce and the potatoes were crunchy in a good way.  My only complaint was the potatoes and the Benedict sauce were super salty.  With the ham, it just didn't need all the additional salt.  Very solid breakfast ... we'll definitely stop again to try a waffle next time we are in the area.

VMSpuAw0SvPQQ_gBNCeYBg.text: Great staff......Great homemade grub....Good pricing....what else could you ask for? Not much more in my opinion.   I had lunch with my father at Kiss the Cook and loved the free mini muffins as a starter. For lunch, I ordered the Eggs Benedict. Straight forward and perfectly on point. Loved it. A great meal and very friendly staff.   I enjoyed the meal and staff so that I took my wife and daughter back the next day. For that meal, I got really crazy and this time ordered the special meatloaf Benedict. :) It too was very good but not as good as their standard egg Benedict. Muffins were still on point. My wife had a custom omelet and daughter the biscuits and gravy. Both really enjoyed their meal and also loved the muffins.  I had been to Kiss the Cook a few times as a child and do not remember it being so tasty. Glad my palette finally woke up.

j1xvkiTztE5HHez5kIY9Fw.text: Simply the best breakfast place in Arizona. The mini muffin basket is worth flying across the country for, all by itself. The bacon is crispy and delicious, the potatoes are seasoned perfectly and they know how to make an over medium egg. I make sure to eat here every time I'm in town!

jPlXVjYNuDSX9qiEB-vTOg.text: What a yummy little breakfast stop! we had the nicest (I swear it was my grandmother) personality! she was so sweet and helpful and polite and got our food quick on a busy morning! Well be back for sure :)

MDN-uORslgEb6Ug0iJyYFw.text: Met a friend for breakfast, early on a glorious summer day. Arrived about 8ish with only 2 tables occupied, but when we left about an hour later the place was hopping with a older, much older crowd.  Seated right away, greeted and asked if we wanted coffee. I would have had a iced flavored but they were out that morning, so ice tea it was. The tea was perfect. Drinks arrived minutes later along with a basket of mini muffins.   Both ordered the 2 egg combo, mine over easy, hers scrambled with bacon.  It took about 10 minutes for our food to arrive. Picture perfect except for the puddle of "butter" on the top of my eggs. Bacon and Grandma potatoes both a mix of crispy and soft.  Drinks refilled.  The place has a homey vibe with everyone, even fellow customers happy and sociable.  Was my breakfast perfect, no, was it good...yes, above average. Prices competitive with chain breakfast joints.  I will return and next time try the eggs Benedict, the lady at the table next to me had it and it looked amazing.  Parking easy too. A enjoyable morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. 2 egg combo

DroAaJH9K5g8hwZ_TPLJyw.text: Kiss the Cook is my all time favorite breakfast place to go in Phoenix! My favorite breakfast to get is the Eggs Benedict, I get it pretty much every time. Today I decided to switch it up and get it cajun styled and it did not disappoint! My friends got the french toast and fell in love with it, they want to come all the time now! My other friend got the omelette and bacon and said the omelette was huge and delicious and the bacon was perfect and juicy!  The servers are always super nice and very helpful if you don't know what you want to get. On the weekends it can get pretty packed and there's a line, but during the week it's not as busy.   I will definitely keep coming back!!

We were visiting Phoenix and decided to stop here since we were staying in Glendale. The service is so great! We loved our waitress. She made the experience wonderful for us! The muffins were fresh baked and so good. We had a mix of breakfast foods and we loved every bit of it! Visit if you're near by!

eBYOcjm2yaex4e_oMn_BLA.text: Visiting some family in the area.  We're from San Francisco and we have enjoyed many good breakfast spots in the Bay Area, but this is one of the best restaurants I've ever been to.    The food was good.  Not amazing but really good.  The hot muffins were hot and our waitress even heated up our syrup so it didn't make my pancake cold.  Omelets looked amazing and my daughter had the yogurt parfait which also looked incredible.  My eggs and bacon were really good too.    The service however was what set this restaurant apart for me.  Our server Rachel was attentive, friendly and knowledgeable.  She got our whole order correct even with substitutions.  And did it all with a smile.  She made great recommendations and checked on our table many times.  She was friendly the whole time and We all really enjoyed her.  I guess she's also a cook here but my suggestion is to move her to front of house.  She's awesome!!!!    If we come back to Phoenix we will definitely back.

UaKDFgDXDX2nU4C_uqse7g.text: My cousin took me to this place, and it's dead on. Cute little place with good food, good service and a pleasant atmosphere. They serve out a little basket of toasty warm muffins before you even eat.  The portion size is perfect unless you order a delicious pecan cinnamon roll.  Enjoy!

AT0d3dzYMuP2edHLaec6cQ.text: Vintage setting that makes you feel you're in your grandma's house. Our waiter was friendly and gave us recommendations. I ended up having the French toast and shared a cinnamon roll. Mouth watering!

4DMZ7pmdFps7Fb4XLErR8w.text: Easy 5 stars.  The food is hot, the portions are big, and they give out muffins as your appetizers!  Their pancakes and waffles are a hit or miss, but their omelets are excellent.  I would definitely recommend Kiss the Cook, even though the area isn't the most appealing.

JyicKpGPxMz7md3f_1HQrw.text: Great omeletes! Service was a bit short handed; yet they did a marvelous job. VERY busy place; I can see why!

gVC2NRXDVRzr_e_t_G2ypQ.text: Every time I come here it makes me feel like I'm at home. Everything from the cute little nicknacks, to the basket of homemade muffins, to the homestyle cooking and to the service. Everything about this place says welcome home to grandmas house. Lol. Love this place! If you're looking for a 5 star classy restaurant then this might not be the place for you but if you are looking for an affordable home cooked meal the. Your at the right place!

r4r4JylXyZAeuVMcgqLIug.text: Went here for breakfast and its pretty good. They have a cute, southern, sitting on the back porch, kind of vibe. I had the veggie benedict w/ the hollandaise on the side. And I really have no complaints. I tried to "tweek"  my order (i.e. avocado instead of mushrooms) and it didn't come out as requested, but it was a busy Sunday morning so I pushed my mushrooms to the side of the plate and kept it moving. The world didn't end and my food was still edible. My friend had the veggie omelet and corn beef hash. I tried his corn beef hash and it was pretty good. It was my first time ever having it so I have nothing to compare it to, but it worked for me. All in all, Kiss the Cook is a cute little breakfast/brunch spot with pretty good food and I will definitely give it another try.

N0cGry9rNz3L7KcAfXECsg.text: We took an Uber to the Fiesta Bowl and our driver pointed out Kiss The Cook as the best breakfast spot in Glendale. Not that I was looking, but KTC had not even been on my restaurant radar. Now, I'll be the first to criticize the Yelp community for having 400+ reviews of 'hip' breakfast joints but it's pulling teeth to get info on certain businesses or restaurants off the beaten path (generating user-content Yelpers, c'mon!) but not being aware of KTC and it's 100+ reviews is entirely on me there, friends.   There was a short wait when we showed up from estate saleing on Saturday morning but the staff was friendly and had us in shortly. I had the New Orleans Omelette and Jenny had the special with the Maple Sausage. All the food was excellent, the service was excellent, and the prices were reasonable. Not a lot of bells and whistles (the mini muffins are a wonderful touch) but KTC is an elite down home breakfast restaurant.   I can't stress enough how much every other "country kitchen" type restaurant can learn from KTC. Understated and over-performing if how I'd describe KTC. It's not the place I'll take my trendy out of town DINK friends after a night at [insert popular Scottsdale club with 600+ Yelp reviews], but it'll definitely be an upgrade for my Cracker Barrel & Denny's dining parents when they come to town.

5NmXVUpNImi-uCQ5hFZKDA.text: Yummy, yummy for the tummy!  Check out this place and for there awesome food!  We had Oscar roll, homemade chili, crepes and a KTC hamburger with home potatoes.  All good and friend, welcoming staff.

AAPom-7WqczwzYjwJYIStw.text: Super cute breakfast spot in Glendale! Delicious food! Also dog friendly on the patio and they have their own menu.  Staff is friendly and the setup is like being at nanas cozy home! Definitely recommend coming here for breakfast!

tYIabTW1iSbR67-OXMbuYg.text: Loved it. Friendly, efficient staff. Warm, welcoming decor. Delicious food - nothing fancy and perfect portions. Very affordable. Exactly what we were looking for. We'll definitely be back.

1UteX0y9xFrnQrexUf69oA.text: I was so glad to find this hidden gem! The food is really good, and the service is some of the best i've seen.

27BGKv4e_VWGP1gs7NLHEw.text: I would rate a 2.5. Our very first experience was amazing a week ago, food was great the cinnamon pecan roll was to die for smothered in the pecan Carmel sauce. service was excellent. Thought this would be our go to place from now on for breakfast with my Wife. But our next experience was not so amazing. Service was really slow, the food was not the same and the cinnamon was not made like it was the first time not so much of the pecan sauce on the roll very disappointed. took a long time to get the attention of our waitress, it appeared that they seemed to cater more towards the regulars that they knew by name. Not sure if we would be returning in hopes it was just a bad day.

bJj66l34OzZF4TMnsz2YvA.text: I went here a couple days ago for breakfast. First of all there decode and mugs are adoreable. Usually I would go with the biscuits and gravy but for some reason my tummy settled on the Belgian waffle w mixed berries , and boy am I glad I did it was dekicious and very affordable. My boyfriend ended up going with the biscuits and gravy (the reason were together) lol but I did not like them I'm not quite sure how to explain the taste but it was not good. There coffee was French vanilla and delicious!

DPGxmKxdfXb9WhkSUFhJsg.text: The food was absolutely delicious, the hot cocoa was fantastic and they sell their adorable mugs. Definitely a win for breakfast :D

C2BzG80nsgZmh8MMMBT8aw.text: Fantastic food! Great prices! Excellent service! Super dog-friendly! No bones about it, I'll be returning for breakfast as often as I'm in Phoenix!

DayQRKq4SwhKpo1npirOVg.text: Perfect way to spend a Sunday morning! Great pancakes and eggs. This place is small and cozy.   We took two small dogs and ordered from the Doggie menu which has several good  options to choose from. This place is family owned and operates with pride!  They make sure you feel welcome and get what you came for! Highly recommended if you want good food inside or out and if you want to take Fido...

LzY-b4B2mziTjaS_mwX0tA.text: Pancakes are very good but as for everything else...... Quite terrible. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone under the age of 65.

NulS55lmGkmWS4K0-bRAgw.text: First time here. First impression. Antique mom and pop shop style of decor and atmosphere. Figured the food was going to be okay at best, but it was way better. The potatoes were nice and crispy, the eggs were perfectly cooked, the cornbeef hash had a nice crispy top layer to it. The price was fairly inexpensive and the food was perfect temperature. Overall a great first experience. I will be returning

ZOiS3dWreTxorDT4h9Bl3g.text: After passing this place countless Xs, curiosity finally got the best of me so we finally stopped in 2 give them a try. There were a couple other occupied tables being tended 2. It was mid~day so it probably gets an influx of business in spurts during other Xs.     W8ed a couple min8es 2 b seated by a friendly hostess who seemed 2 b busy helping the w8ress(es) serve up orders/refills. Woulda preferred seating ourselves if not 4 the w8 2 b seated sign, instead of feeling awkward by the stares of the elderly patrons there but got settled in2 a centrally loc8ed small table. No booths in case u wanted 2 know.     I guess I understand the draw of this place 4 those that want the old fashioned home~style feel but dining there felt like being @ a cross between a Brass Armadillo & an Elderly Care facility. Though I did like looking @ some of the antiques 4 sale there, just felt a bit strange ~ almost like they're trying 2 pull off the ol' Bobby McGee's concept w/ vintage items like victorian boots, tubs etc but geared toward the much older.     Even tho I wasn't personally impressed or as comfortable as I'd like, everything was ok/tolerable part of our experience till we Eventually got acknowledged by our w8ress who acted as tho we were graced by her presence, snapping what~dya~want @ us. I almost replied: 'a different server'... but bit my tongue 1dering if this was just part of the 'charm'.     I ordered the Vegetarian sandwich & my companion went w/ the Seafood Omelette w/ iced tea & tomato juice 4 our beverage as she briskly walked away huffing/puffing/snorting like a bull ready 2 impale a matador. The hostess came over shortly w/ our drinks & a 1derful basket of cute li'l assorted mini muffins which turned out 2 b the best part of our meal/experience here, esp the AWESOME zucchini 1s!     Tomato juice was just V~8 in a glass & the iced tea tasted soapy & bitter. Don't know if there was soap not rinsed out in the cup but if it was straight from the tea dispenser, it was far more than soapy 'residue' & the tea part I could even make out, tasted like liquified mold so EWWW we reluctantly drank water instead w8ing 2 notify the hostess as we didn't want others getting sick or 2 evoke more wrath from the server who was intent on giving every1 hell.      When our food was ready 2 b served, she stomped over & musta mistaken our pl8es 4 frisbees as they were nearly flung @ us, mine almost skid in2 my lap!! Didn't ask if we wanted/needed anything else & was done w/ us till slamming our damages slip down when she was obviously ready 4 us 2 pay/get rid of us. The prices here might have felt like a pretty good deal if more of what we ordered was decent. Perhaps it was a case of we spontaneously picked a bad day 2 go w/ an equally bad cook & w8ress or maybe they were a couple till that morning & the break~up was gonna make every1 else suffer!!     I don't know if our server was having the worst day of her life or what, but apparently any1 else who had the mis4tune of her w8ing on them was getting the same treatment, so I guess we weren't being targeted. I even overheard a guy @ her other table telling her 'I thought I did something 2 make u mad @ me'. I couldn't make out what else was said, but it was obvious the poor hostess/cashier was trying 2 divert any neg8ivity by joking it off as something else.     The Veg sandwich was good (not gr8 nor bad but slightly better than ok). His Seafood Omelette made him spit in2 his napkin st8ing it was overly salty (probably trying 2 cover up what he called 'unfresh ingredients & bad seafood'). Leaving most of his pl8, was never asked if everything was ok or if there was a prob cuz it was blatantly apparent that the snapping turtle who could only bark @ people really didn't give a F*ck except 2 make others b the outlet 4 her nastiness!! We always treat our servers nice & respectfully, making things easier 2 b cleared (which they never were) & whatever the case was w/ this 1, she either needed 2 leave the drama @ home or better yet stay home OR here's a concept: not work in any scenario that involves having 2 interact w/ customers/public in any facet...     Kiss the Cook? More like, kiss their (_y_) A$S & still get sh*t!  IF we ever Dared 2 give them another shot (highly unlikely after what we were subjected 2), we'd b certain that some1/ANY1 else w8ed on us. Actually, scratch that ~ we'd have 2 make sure she wasn't there, cuz I'm sure I'm not the only 1 who doesn't wanna jump every other min8 w/ her slamming/snappy mouth/throwing things while trying 2 eat... nor feel like WEARING what was ordered (which depending on what it is) might b better than actually eating it ~ YIKES!!

obwyu8XuSHMBwBJtz_Z9_g.text: Let's see. It took 10 minutes before someone took our drink order. Then, for some reason, you are forced to wait for a basket of cheap dry muffins, before they will take your order. From the time we sat down, until the time we were served, it took exactly one hour. This is breakfast we are talking about. My over medium eggs, arrived over-hard. And the waiter forgot my toast. I sent the eggs back, and they punished me with some extremely Ronnie called very over easy eggs. I guess they just didn't want to make them over medium. I guess I'm a prick for thinking I can order food there way I like it in a restaurant. I will never go back to this place again.

GGoq8k0EOy40HA268X040A.text: Excellent breakfast special.  I am visiting from out of town and read some great reviews for their breakfast here.  I was not disappointed.  Great service and a nice atmosphere.

n5cPmXYZxr2bKXkUW9vOuw.text: 03/19/10  Kitschy, fun country-life decor.  There was about a 15-minute waiting time.  Lots of older citizens waiting, which made for interesting chit-chat amongst the women.  It's refreshing when a restaurant's setting allows people to feel comfortable enough to interact among strangers-- Mom and I encounter so many "closed" individuals on a daily basis at work, so this is a nice change of pace for us.  Staff here seem friendly and busy, but efficient.  At least, ours was.  One complaint: it's a bit cramped in here.  It would be nice to have a little privacy from other neighboring tables, especially when I spied a room in the back that had maybe four 4-tops, and only one was occupied.  Can't recall what Mom ordered, but I wasn't surprised that she didn't enjoy it-- the menu description definitely did not appeal to me.  Website does not list a menu, and all I can recall is that it was an omelet w/ a couple of fibrous veggies (snow peas and something else; it was a strange combo, of that I'm sure of.  Chestnuts, maybe?).  I went w/ a Belgian waffle, two eggs, and bacon.  Coffee was weak, but our server offered to brew a stronger pot.  Nice!  While we waited for our selections, she brought out some mini-muffins to enjoy, and that we did!  We both really liked the bran.  I also enjoyed the zucchini-- Mom thought she detected cinnamon (not a fave of hers), but I think it's the nutmeg she was referring to.  Then again, I may be mistaken...  Waffle was, well, a waffle.  No accompanying fruit compotes or coulis to liven things up.  I always bring my own 100% organic maple syrup, because while most restaurants say they offer maple syrup, it isn't 100% pure, but a blend of maple and corn syrups.  (If it smells like Mrs. Butterworth's, it isn't 100% maple.  Just sayin'.)  Eggs were cooked to over-medium, just that way I like 'em.  Bacon was very nice.  Cute saucer and dinner plates, lovely mini-muffins (we bought extra to-go!), good bacon, and efficient service make for a solid two stars.  I wouldn't mind giving KTC another try, if we're in the area.  Next time we'll try the pancakes and crepes!

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. 1/2 a Belgian waffle, eggs, and bacon.
Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Poor choice of an omelet.
Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Delicious mini-muffins for the table!

6Qjztym7S-JHmZ4FS1Fn4Q.text: Kiss the Cook is a cute little breakfast nook in Glendale. I ordered the Corned Beef Hash, which came with has, two eggs, and potatoes. Also, they give you a basket of mini muffins for the table if you order certain items from the menu. The mini muffins are a nice touch and the bran flavor is best in my opinion. The corned beef hash was tasty, however it was a bit oily and greasy for my taste. Potatoes were really good as well. My one complaint was the portion sizes were a little small. Usually I have a hard time finishing everything on the plate, but here I ate everything and was still left feeling a little hungry. Overall, Kiss the Cook is worth the trip if you are in the neighborhood.

BKeaWpyafXPKBA8LBZZXOw.text: Amazing little place for breakfast!! Great food and the prices are not bad. Good service. The decor is sure to catch your eye!!!  Will come again.

wCVgc0ocrE63kKpbYux71A.text: The hubby and I were going out for breakfast but we realized the place we wanted to tryout was closed, so we decided to stop here.  We got seated right away.  I have driven passed this place numerous amounts of times but once you walk in, it was definitely not what I expected.  This place was quite quaint.  I liked it.  Our server was really, really sweet.  My husband ordered their special French toast with orange something and cream cheese...it sounded really good.  I ordered the biscuits and gravy.  They brought us a muffin basket and those mini muffins were really tasty.  Our food comes out and my husband hates it.  He says it tasted like imitation orange flavoring.  Of course I had to try, to me it was really strong on the orange maybe too much zest....I don't know.  My food was real good.  I wanted my eggs over-medium...they were much more runny than I like.  The biscuits and gravy were decent, not Crackle Barrel but good.  So needless to say, I saw that face of disappointment on my husband and I knew that there was no way I would be able to enjoy the rest of my meal.  So I hurried and ate what I could, paid and drove his butt to McD.

siiS7xpCXzcnMxqniELDfg.text: We stopped here for lunch today on our way home from outlet shopping. My mom had heard about it and so we decided to try it. Obviously lots of regulars as they all seemed to be known by the waitresses. It several minutes before we even got water and when our waitress did bring water she was less than friendly. No greeting and no offer to ask if we had questions or to tell us about the specials. I ordered a BLT and the bread was barely toasted. It came with a bag of Lays potato chips. My mom had the chicken salad over fruit and the fruit was not very good. Also came with a muffin which turned out to be Mini muffin. We then ordered the dessert special which was an apple dumpling and recommended by the waitress. It was okay but a little burnt! Lots of clutter and junky stuff as part of decor. Needless to say we won't travel to Glendale again to eat there but the locals will likely keep the place in business!

07BQ0PbiDH1M8uenJjJeBA.text: Not impressed - food was flavorless. The set-up was cramped but cute vintage and unique. Wait staff looked run down but were nice. My corn beef hash was mushy with uncooked veggies.  The basket of muffins was okay but dry. My wife's biscuit and gravy was bland and cold, potatoes had no seasoning. We wasted $30 and the only pleasant was the wheat toast and my son's pancakes. Even the bacon was soggy and it is hard to hate bacon. We will not return.

ztGe5QydRaahBYeM9Fga1A.text: If you are looking for pancakes, this is the place to be! These pancakes are so fluffy it's like eating clouds! The service isn't great,

vXWoEdNoBQSFoZvxQWgp_A.text: The wait can be long. The food is good and mini muffins are fabulous! The restaurant itself needs a good cleaning. Service is ok. A place to try at least once.

SouQ5E4zG_E28hAwVyTwbg.text: A "home cooked" meal. No frills, not much for spices but a  decent breakfast. Mom had the 3 egg omelet which was full of her 3 toppings, good portion. I had the country breakfast with scrambled eggs & cheese & added a side of crispy bacon. Both were good. Comes with biscuit & gravy & potatoes, though they forgot my potatoes (they were brought after I asked). B & G were nothing to get excited about, though we may be B & G snobs but there wasn't much flavor & they had a cafeteria style to them. Hubby ordered the "hay stack" & was hugely disappointed & underwhelmed. It is a layer of hash browns topped with choice of eggs, sausage links, more hash browns topped with country gravy & a sprinkle if cheese. We were expecting a generous portion of goodness & it was in a little crock dish :-( Thankfully our portions were generous so we shared eggs & potatoes & half my biscuit to fill him up. Server was extremely kind & attentive though a little slow overall outside. With the many choices the area has to offer, likely we won't return.

V8MEOU_rHMt3EhIkqaBJEA.text: I'm trying exceptionally hard to be nice here.  Hence, the three stars rather than negative stars and I'll get into why they deserve three stars and not five stars.  What saves this place from negative stars or a one star.  They are a local breakfast brunch location that serves up something a bit different from your standard same 'ol same 'ol breakfast eateries or diners.  What sets KTC apart from the rest, is the home style feel - like a quilted cottage with frilly things about and hanging wicker baskets.  I feel like I'm intruding whenever I'm eating here - as if three bears were to waltz on in and it would be a Papa bear, mama bear, and a baby bear.  The baby bear being the winiest of the three, but I concur why after breaking his dang chair and eating all of his food - who wouldn't get mad?  I'd be Pi$$ed.  Anywho.  The muffin baskets?  Whaaaattt?  And they're absolutely delicious and to die for!  That deserves a star and a half right there.  The waitress staff are the golden girls and they know how to charm each and everyone one of them.  On their breaks, they crotchet more decorations for the rest of the place.  It's ongoing, and it never ends.  Service is great.  Seriously, a bit crammed - in fact, waaaay too crammed which leads me to why this place is getting the review of 3 stars. I started my first job in the fast food industry and moved myself up to working at local restaurant's and steak houses - bussing tables before serving.   If you have a popular location that is crammed, than you have to make up for it with efficient turn-around times on your tables.  Bussing tables.  It's not really hard.  It's not really that difficult.  And it's seriously.....did I say, not that hard?  So, KTC restaurant seriously....I'm not sure if they hire developmentally challenged kids from a local boys and girls club (I'm trying my hardest not to be insensive but I already ruined it with the Golden girls reference, so what the heck right?) anyway.....I've never in my wildest imagination, can make up the time it took for one busser guy (you only had one job pal....one job.  ONE JOB) and still manages to screw it up.) bussed one table outside - about a 4 top round table - about 6 drinking glassware, assorted plates about 6, a coffee mug, some food scraps, napkins, etc.  Nothing too crazy.  27 minutes.    TWENTY SEVEN FREAKING MINUTES.  Did he leave to crotchet with the other girls?  Was he busy elsewhere?  Did he transform into a fixed street lamp on the corner waiting for nothing?  Excuses.  Once you start bussing a table, bus it until it's done, get it ready and prepped for the waiting bazillion people for the love of god!  This guy, seriously, took one glass with both hands...moved it to a cocktail tray that could hold no more than 4 glasses that he set outside a plastic garbage dumpster with lid - than, proceeded to lurch himself towards the table for aaaaannnnnnoooooooootttttttttthhhhhhhhhhhhhheeeeeeeerrrrrrrrrrrrrrr glllllaaaassss ccccccuuuuuupppppp.  By the time you were done reading that part, he would have been only halfway reaching for that glass cup.  Yeah, no joking here folks.  My jaw dropped.  He had help from a Golden girl, but she couldn't do all the work for him.  My lovely wife informed me, "maybe they just don't have bus tubs..." I was like, "yeah...buuuuutt" and as she said that.....Another busser from inside came outside and he had a bus tub.  I was like, okay....so, they have just that one slow guy right?  Wrong.  Even bus tub busser was having a hard time helping out cleaning the table.  Seriously?  They would leave entirely and not return until later and take a glass off or two.  Inside, was probably ten minutes faster, but they left tables open with an hour and half wait - seriously?  What is Beavis and Butthead doing?  Why is there no sense of urgency to clear a freaking table - you're losing customers or their patience.   Okay, I'm fine......seriously, we finally got seated after my children had already grown older and we no longer needed any children's menus.  They were adults now.  Good, we could have that chat that I been meaning to talk to them about.  My girls WERE 4 and 6.  Were.    Seriously Kiss the Cook - you guys have something special going on.  The food is excellent and you guys do honor Entertainment book coupon, and have such nice staff.  You have a cozy place but your parking sucks.  (hint to those driving around in circles in the parking lot - go to the lot just west of you; you're going to have to leave the parking lot first and than go to the street and go back into the 50,000,000 sq ft empty lot that is mere feet from the actual restaurant) - walk a foot or two, it aint going to kill you peeps.)   But, clean off those tables and get things turned around quicker...seriously!  It could be sooo much better and I want it to be.  I'll be back again with a coach's whistle and stop watch  on my next visit.  Seriously, bussers only have ONE JOB.....ONE!!!!

XjZPilY6Q5EnLf68IjtI9Q.text: Only been here twice but must we've had nothing less than an awesome experience. Amazing food and great customer service...no complaints here, woild highly recommend to anyone. Also luv the decor, and their doggie treats are great too im guessing, our little 4 legged friend always enjoys them.

MmNqc9xKaK_fTagsELq9KA.text: Kiss the cook is one of those places where it seems like a 50/50 chance that you will either have a good experience or an OK one. Judging by the initial reviews you would think this place is the go to breakfast place.  That isn't the case.  Its OK.  Nothing special nothing great.  First off the service is lousy.  I have been told that you should always tip the most at breakfast.  Why?  There is something about going to a place and seeing empty tables that erks me when the hostess puts your name down and there is a wait.  Be it 5 minutes or 20 if there are empty tables sit the customer down.  I know that they try to evenly distribute customers to waitress for tips and what not but give me a break.  This place is not that big.  To be fair when we finally sat down our waitress was pretty nice.    After seating it took about ten minutes for the waitress to take our order.  I got the corn beef and hash and my fiance got the kiss the cook special.  The corn beef was good.  The portion size however was maybe a scoop full.  Kind of disappointing.  It came with two eggs and potatoes.  Again portion size not too great.  The food was good though I like the southwest seasoning that you can put on it.  My fiance got 2 eggs 2 pancakes and sausage.  Her pancakes were pretty thick and the eggs looked good.  It was perfect portion for her.  The food came with a mini muffin basket which was cool and apple butter.  The coffee looked a little watered down but overall tasted OK.  They didn't have splenda but sweet and low was fine.    Overall the experience was not much different then Denny's or village inn.  The food was OK nothing fancy.  This is either a place that you will absolutely love or just say ehh.  If your in the mood for a big breakfast don't come here.  If you want to leave filling just right this is the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. 6.75 corn beef and hash pretty tasty portion size ok

fKlNqMTHWcBDYtbuMAcJnQ.text: Excellent breakfast place. It was so pleasant with the old knickknacks and great service. You could tell their were a some regulars when we went. The food was good, and I'm not a breakfast person. Happy 33rd birthday!

CrkKiKJjEWwuuJFJRKdMCg.text: Good fresh and home cooked food. Loved breakfast especially biscuits and gravy Small quaint place that does get busy. Decent pricing.

_T2hNJA87xue8q-wJEtOCA.text: Like the massive three egg omelet but not happy with the ingredients used. Broccoli, jalapeno, etc. should be fresh, not the canned option. Service is ok, prices are fair. Will definitely pass on this place.

JcJovdX6nieKkzTdk6QeIA.text: It's is a cute place and gets a good crowd. I think the food is okay. It is not served as the average place and definitely has a home cooked feel which makes it better, but I think it's average. Maybe lunch is better than breakfast.

YO7XV515pLv7IgwLzgvEeA.text: Delicious food and very nice servers. The food is reasonably priced and they aren't stingy with their portions. Cute place and you get mini muffins

Arjx2MVXTyaHjOtxnnSSnA.text: Not satisfied. Omelete was just ok, potatoes overcooked-hard to eat, pancakes small-thin, coffee not hot, they should take more pride in breakfast to get me to come back.

y6AfGXWKBD0Q2q_zdwizdQ.text: Delicious, home cooked breakfast. Susan our waitress was very pleasant and extremely efficient.  Visiting from California and will be back again for sure.

nTPEhRaTST6mrvgJ0tq0dw.text: Just the best place. The food is outstanding, especially the complimentary zucchini muffins. The Service is great too. We were third in line and only waited a few minutes. Would have been even faster if it weren't for two rude twenty something women with a baby. When we walked in they had finished their meal, and their check was on the table. But they sat there visiting for at least another 40 minutes oblivious to other customers waiting for a table. Where does this generation get off thinking that the world revolves around them and to heck with the wait staff that needs to earn a living. If I weren't worried about being arrested I would have yanked them out of their chairs by their hair! BRATS

3j6Bxk3Q1QzMzsJeV9khwg.text: What a cute little spot! Very homey. And the staff were friendly. Cute little country style place. Couldn't resist the mini muffins while we waited. Delicious! We will be coming back again and again. It was busy but the service was impeccable.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. My daughter&#39;s first taste of ham. Guess it tasted good because she wouldn&#39;t let it go after one taste!

mD3ypxiEOJKaPwsuBmPbNw.text: Everything about this place was Superb! Waited less than 5 minutes for breakfast on a Sunday and never had an empty cup of coffee. Portions were perfect and prices are reasonable. Will definitely be back!

5DEgdkvIKgQf30UemQFO8A.text: Gosh, this restaurant is so cute and absolutely delicious. They bring you out free muffins while you wait for your breakfast. You can tell that it is family-owned and that they take pride in this restaurant. The prices are really great and the service always is too.

luW_-zmBkorEhbFEz8kFDQ.text: A small cozy restaurant the food was really good it was a busy day but I felt our waitress could've been more friendlier. I think overall we really liked this place and the basket of muffins are so yummy that's a seller. Only reason I give it four is because trying to pay was the hassle. The cash register is so close to the door and people waiting the people cut in front of you and you're just taking forever to check out

Sl9GJrBi-giJ8e8G0nQsPg.text: Just started working in this area, and first day the boss says, that he is going to be in late so you can wait a few hours to come, since I wanted to be early and was already in the area, and skipped breakfast to get there on time, I was starved and this place looked like a good breakfast spot. I was wrong.  It was a GREAT breakfast spot. Service was fast, polite, and the food was great. I got the make your own omelet with the potatoes and some coffee and tea. The coffee mugs are unique compared to any place I have ever been to, they are a clear glass mug. It was a bit different. Overall very very good. I just kind of relaxed and enjoyed my meal, no rush it was very good, and the portions were pretty hefty, you can never tell what your going to get at these smaller places. So I was pleasantly surprised. And my check was less then $15.00 so not to shabby for the portion sizes. And i almost forgot they give you this basket of these delicious little tiny muffins, these things are like biting into heaven. They were so good. Pretty sure they are complimentary.   This place has a real small town feel to it, you could tell allot of the people inside were regulars. Everybody seemed really friendly.   The only reason this place didn't get five stars, because the parking lot didn't really have a good parking set up to get in, I had to walk around the building across the porch which was kind of dirty and could use a coat of paint or protection, and I didn't see any handicap spots...if they were there the signs were not very visible. That and it could use a good thorough cleaning on the inside, lots of nick knacks and stuff up, they are all pretty dusty. Could use a good cleaning.   Over all thou, a real good experience I will be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Never seen coffee served in a glass mug like this. Unique.

HCqLJvMT7zEiCyrg2pjBnQ.text: This dog-friendly restaurant is amazing! The food is incredible and so is the service! The dog friendly porch iusually isn't open on weekdays but they opened it up for me and my cockapoo. They even made him scrambled eggs in a dog dish. udgKPBSJkerluvQrV_nZ_Q.text: The place has a tone of clutter. It's like your grandmas house threw up in there. There is a ton of dust on the clutter. That was a big turn off. We were  recommended their pancakes and biscuits and gravy and they ended up being bad. We did not finish our food and when they asked we let them know how we felt about the food. They brushed it off like we didn't know what we were talking about.  I do not recommend this place at all. Everything was subpar.

pAm55m1GOWdcWqlnQQzglA.text: This place is adorably quaint and the food is awesome. The muffin baskets that they give you are a nice touch. But the service was not so great and the food was slow to come out.

Bknmy55p5l9NRyvHOFKT8Q.text: Good Food, fast, friendly service definitely one of my favorite places to eat. Our waiter was kind and the restaurant had a friendly environment for everyone to love!

oHDVPK7tED08W3F-xWwpJw.text: I love the funky and very eclectic decor. If your bored with conversation you can always look at all the different things on the walls. I had a basic breakfast which was really good. No trouble with runny eggs or over cooked. The dinner ware did not match which is all a part of this eclectic atmosphere. The place was packed and the only negative thing I can say; they were short on staff and we waited a very long time for water/coffee and worse for her to come back to take our order.

The best part were the tiny muffins, while you wait, hit the spot with the coffee! We will definitely come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States

yTpbBk0cb2GWD0QW16JRCw.text: This is possibly the most adorable looking restaurant in Glendale. You walk in to what looks like an antique shop with a grandma's dining room kind of look. They offer a large dog friendly patio and the Facebook page says to ask for the dog menu so I really wanted to love this place.   They started us off with fresh hot just baked mini muffins of two varieties one tasted like vanilla cake with chocolate chips the other was some sort of spiced muffin. They reminded me of box mixes.  My cajun chicken caesar salad arrives. The greens look fresh and crisp and the garlic parmesan breadstick looks like cheesy toast. I tasted the chicken and it taste very salty and over marinated like processed chicken from Costco. It might be the teriyaki flavor topped with too much salt. The taste of it made my stomach upset. The one thing I tried that was delicious was the crispy cheesy toast they gave me. They should feature that toast on the menu because it was unique and tasty. It was kind of like a crispy grilled cheese. I had to share it with my husband because there were some issues with his meal.  My husband had the breakfast special. It was missing the green onions and tomatoes that our waiter said would it would have. The eggs were fine but the pulled pork under the eggs lacked favors and the muffins underneath needed some toasting because they were very soggy. Lastly they forgot to fry the potatoes. It seemed like someone took a baked potato cut it up and just threw it in the oven. This made the potatoes very dry like chalk.  Sadly I have to kiss this place good bye!

AhgvzmtzspkITMzATLcAVg.text: Definitely worth the wait!  We just flew in from Atlanta so our bodies were ready for lunch but in AZ it's still breakfast time so thanks to Yelp we found this amazing place!  Do not let the outside appearance deter you...it's very quaintly decorated inside with an eclectic mix of antiques and baskets and mismatched furniture. We were thankful to be seated in the back corner at a cute antique round oak table where we could observe the happy customers being served by a very friendly, however, very busy staff since it was a Saturday morning.   Their signature mini muffins served to every table were bran, zucchini and pineapple today and they make their own apple butter to go along with the butter served in the muffin basket. We were each able to taste all the flavors as our basket held six muffins.   My husband ordered the breakfast special which was The Sonoran Pork Omelette with a chile verde sauce served with melted Monterey Jack cheese over the top. Since his initial craving was for Costa Vida this was a perfect brunch option and I had a hard time keeping my own fork off of his plate!  They literally whip their eggs to create the thickest fluffiest omelet we'd ever seen!  He also ordered a side of biscuits and gravy which were very good with a sprinkling of table pepper although I personally like more flavor in my gravy, the biscuits were amazing.   I ordered the Belgian waffle combo with blueberries which was served with the perfect over-medium eggs I requested and the most flavorful thick crisp bacon I think I've ever tasted. My only critique would be that for the cost of the berry option I would have thought there would be more than 20 small blueberries on my half of a waffle.   Sandy was a very friendly and attentive server and was assisted by an equally friendly nearby server when our water glasses were close to empty.   We would absolutely recommend this uniquely quaint restaurant if you ever find yourself anywhere near Glendale...about 15 minutes from the PHX airport.

photos.caption: Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Belgian Waffle combo--DELICIOUS...but maybe skip the whipped butter since it was made with a delicious buttermilk batter
Photo of Kiss the Cook Restaurant - Glendale, AZ, United States. Sonoran Omelet

-9ErvT49CVmvP7bbEiwoVA.text: This place makes me feel like I'm spending time at my grandma's house. Waitresses are sweet as pie and make you feel like you are their kids/grandkids. Plenty of options on the menu including three kinds of Eggs Benedict! Not the cheapest meal in town but I'll pay a little extra for great food and great service.
