gPXh-t0j8gQfDIyGXNohxw.text: I've been here several times and think today was my last.   They have a great idea here, the older sweet servers, antique furniture and decor - overall ambiance.  The food has been good enough for me to visit on more than one occasion but nothing I've ever been to crazy about.   On my visit today, I ordered the crab cake Benedict and my girlfriend ordered the biscuits and gravy. My food came out cold and I sent it back, wasn't apologized to or checked back up on. I was on the fence about this place already and that tipped it. You are a restaurant - one job. Make good food and if it isn't - make it right! You guys had a wonderful opportunity to have me come back again in the future, but when I told the cashier about my experience it gets even better!!  When I told her about my poor service she basically said sorry and cut me off to find our server to make sure we were charged properly for my girlfriends turkey sausage. She spent more time trying to make sure we were being charged for the sausage than our experience.   Biscuits and gravy were good though! I would recommend checking something else out - seems like quite a few yelpers agree.

bKW4fXiOHlZKKOmNUXrkxw.text: Yummy food! They gave us Hersey kisses with our check!  Adorable country-store like decor

yunDz3I9oR1WX4xil_KJ9w.text: I'll never go back there. Pricey, overrated and we just felt out of place. The "eclectic" atmosphere didn't make up for the unwelcome feeling we had. Never again. There are way too many places that deserve our hard earned money. The food was forgettable!

ojKST3Kg4aoaDMV67bwkUw.text: Food was good. Service was horrible. It was a busy day but it should take asking 3 times to get straws and silverware. Also had to get are reheated.

FhYsokfz-VGkvko1DbpGsA.text: After all these years, I finally came and tried this establishment.  The parking spaces were limited.  Watch where you park!     A long line was already out the door waiting for a table. Why are brunch places always so busy?  The decor reminded me of Glendale's antique shops. They have a bunch of baskets hanging and other random items surrounded the restaurant. Its interesting decor.   Upon entering the restaurant, there was a strong burnt odor in the dining area.  I'm assuming their vents weren't working.   I had the Country Breakfast with 2 eggs, biscuits & gravy, and fried potatoes. The biscuits & gravy didn't taste fresh and homemade. Fried potatoes were basically scorched.  They were tasteless and hard.  It helped when you sprinkle with plenty of black peppers.  The staff was efficient and friendly.  I love a place still give out free warm muffins. I would return just to order the basket of muffins. It was absolutely delicious.

IIbFVEnKf0swC1H_61Rcgw.text: Got the oatmeal very good put nuts and granola in it and came with muffins . Old vibes

Aj42teynKK-Q63-KAE097g.text: We drove quite a way to this restaurant because hubs wanted to try the Cajun Omelet. He was not disappointed and challenged his need for spicy. I had a the snow pea, mushroom, and water chestnut omelet. Three of my fav things and a very nice treat. The basket of muffins were fabulous and I'm embarrassed to say I hogged them all. Only 4 stars because hubs said the coffee was pretty weak.

PlCenrunFV3tE4-r1b6ABw.text: I have gone here a couple times and both have been good experiences. Family place and very busy! Went with friends and we all enjoyed our food and left full. The price is reasonable and the food is brought out quickly. The servers were nice older ladies. Delicious gray and biscuits! Would suggest trying them yourself!

hpD9dH4kATc6zzN1CmLYNw.text: Great breakfast! Service and food were really good. We got dog menus for my pups and they gave four stars too!

K_5NWkOA1V-3XLRY8IbvOA.text: Quick last minute breakfast order was perfect and fast.  Take out order still provides fresh and delicious muffins.

EInakUv9FhPH5lJ_b3Jr9A.text: What a beautiful and eclectic place to eat. The decor is so lovely and country, they have all of the little pieces I'd love to have. I love this cafe! However I do have a bit of complaint about the cleanliness of the restrooms. As for the food it's basic. Simple omelets and simple breakfast foods. Some items are more tasty than others and some items I simply cannot try. The coffee was great (however no non-dairy options for creamers) Come check it out for yourself and you be the judge. I'll still come back again.

My stepmom and I really enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant. I gave it 4 stars because service was iffy in a nearly empty restaurant.

It's as though Gramma (yes, "Gramma" is synonymous for ALL grandmothers) opened up her kitchen to the public and can make you anything you desire... within reason of course.  The decor is quaint and well done, the staff is sassy and friendly, and the food is epic!! I'm so glad I stumbled upon them.

szommBPf5C1jdmx2KUG01A.text: Good food, reasonably priced, good service. These are important factors when I consider if I will return to a place of business.  Hour wait time was not too long on a Saturday morning. There was coffee and water outside for those waiting to be seated. When we got inside it was a little crowded but the food was good. I ordered the Cook's breakfast (might be called something else... this was a couple days ago).  It came with pancakes, eggs, sausage, and the mini muffins. The mini muffins are my favorite part-like most people's, specifically the zucchini ones.  I will come back!

V3Pz5FD-Z6KsFnXqqCWkyw.text: The food is always good and the muffins are too die for. The service is good but good food doesn't come without a small wait. Even the tea and coffee are awesome. You want to try this place.

pp7WEB5YHZ8o7xLmKUcYEg.text: Large menu, good breakfast, decent coffee. Muffin basket is usually really good but sometimes you get all of the same flavor instead of an assortment. Avoid the cinnamon rolls...too dry and harden while you are eating them.

cKecOXwwYLyandL9ariDLw.text: Everyone is very nice ! The services was great never ran low on coffee ^_^ and their food is so yummy . Loved the spot will be going again  for sure .

jaGJM_M5IGrI03wkY_iJdA.text: Quaint little place. I enjoyed the eggs benidict. The wee muffins are moist and delicious.  They also have a biscuit for fido. So sweet!

pAJp-fsFUQQB7qQSc-Bhcw.text: Our 2nd. sat. ladies choose a different place every month. We went to Kiss the Cook today. Had a very nice young man wait on us. Food was good,  service fast and best of all coffee cups kept full. Reason for 4 stars is food and service. Would have given 5 but need to do something with restrooms. Not a very nice snell when you go in. Clean but yucky odor.

OhetHAZt7SYI4X1l84EViw.text: We enjoyed breakfast there yesterday morning. Our server Steven was fantastic. The food was incredible. My son got the cinnamon roll, I got the strawberry stuffed French toast, and my daughter had the banana pancakes. They cooked the bananas in the pancakes which was unexpected but was very tasty. The cinnamon roll was phenomenal, the stuffed French toast was great but was stuffed with cream cream and the strawberries were on the outside still good though.   The service was great, food was great, and it was a beautiful morning so we sat on the patio and it was overall a great experience.   The only downfall was the kitchen was backed up so it was quite a long wait for the food but at least the server kept us informed about he hold ups. Communication is key and it was worth the wait.

YfODXVsr899m_DmXqHfccw.text: I will start by saying food is very good yet a little overpriced in my personal opinion. Still 5 star worthy for food quality. I took one star for the service. The server was a little rude and cold(maybe she had a bad night sleep, who knows) and seemed bother by first timers asking about menu items.   Had the biscuits and gravy. All very fresh and tasty. Coffee kept coming in not by our server by someone else, strange but il keep it.   Overall i might try this place in the future.

y7jzG367IXla-jK7wjmaNg.text: I had been waiting to try breakfast at this place for awhile. We visited on a Sunday around 11am. Waited about 15 minutes. As soon as we walked in, we were not greeted. Then the lady finally said "what's your name and how many?". After we gave her the info she never said anything else she just ignored us like we weren't standing there then asked the next person the same thing. I thought it was very rude to be honest and I wanted to leave but my boyfriend wanted to try the food also. The waitress was nice. The food took some time to come out. Muffins were nothing special. You don't get much food. I ordered the huevos rancheros and I took one bite and did not touch the rest. They had huge tomatoes in there with oinions and big pieces of bell peppers which I never seen on huevos rancheros. All I ate was the potatoes which tasted like bacon or sausage (This is a problem because I dont eat pork). We will not be returning.

2LIsRfhO3b3RzXqUNveT8w.text: Kiss the cook is an awesome restaurant. It is locally owned and the food is really amazing. Its quaint with antiques and homemade desserts. I ordered the biscuit and gravy meal. It came with a bakers basket, a small basket with 6mini homemade muffins. They were piping hot and delicious. My meal came with potatoes, eggs and biscuits and gravy. I added 2slices bacon for only 1.75. My husband had the Cajun omelette it had a spicy hollandaise sauce. He devoured the whole thing.   Everything tastes like it is made from scratch and very fresh. If you are in Glendale you need to check it out. They are open until 2:30 so plan accordingly.

aUw8JXdFdrTwND9v2O1y6w.text: We stopped here for an early breakfast and the food was really good. The atmosphere is laid back and the staff is nice. We loved the muffins with our meal too!

XhmwxKOG1UY0JpDE8n5zkA.text: I found this restaurant on Yelp and it was quite an experience. This is a very small place but they also have an outside patio. The place is very unique and full of antique decorations (which some are for sale). I went on a Monday late morning and the place was full! we had to wait a little to be seated. The food was good, the bacon was nice and crispy. The pancakes were soft and fluffy but a bit small compared to other breakfast places I've been too.(nothing bad) Deepening on what you choose, they give you small muffins, the muffins were delicious! However, I did find their coffee to be very light , it lack a robust taste. Over all this is a great place to have a good breakfast! The menu prices are very reasonable, and once again their decor is super cute.

5rBi29Re-UxwT3oarwLUlA.text: Like Cracker Barrel except slower service and slower food prep time, and a paucity of seating.  The building is extremely long and narrow from the outside view, thereby leading to expectations of a roomy interior but then you get inside and feel tricked.  There's a small counter and cluttered waitstaff area that takes up a good chunk of the non-cooking area inside, and then what looks like a living room sized seating area is all that's left.  On a Monday morning I was barely able to get a table.  I can't imagine the weekends.  Food was above average, prices were fair, but I thought the portions were too small.  For $5 it's a very small stack of 3 pancakes, and you're not eating into the profit margin much by having them actually fit the entire surface of the plate.  My order was more like the side order that you get for free with an omelette purchase at IHOP, except that the pancakes were spread out on the plate instead of stacked up straight.  And the place does have that Cracker Barrel cute country feel to it, but the old part of Glendale isn't convenient for most of us, especially this portion that is immersed by used car dealers, pawn shops, and homeless pedestrians.

2N4Rz0TgkI4ESTb5ieY0UA.text: Just awesome! Cute atmosphere and great service. Ginger bronie rocked! Muffins were delicious. Will definitely go back again. Thank you!

g-asbieYX6n6fTdqxtWT0w.text: It took forever to get seated. And then I couldnt get waited on.  I was second in line and two tables were open. More tables opened up. I asked to be seated but the hostess was one of those anal types who could not multitask. She let 10 people gather before seating anyone.  After being seated I waited and waited. Three waitresses walked by but still no service. Got fed up and left. I think it is typical for a single woman to get less attention than when she is with a man. Should have brought Big Poppa, I guess.  Kiss the Cook has always had so-so service but the good food keeps me coming back.

ys1Vo9bMK8-hpntz57pSgQ.text: We finally had a opportunity to try this place after all the rave about it. We have heard nothing but good things about this place. So we came in expecting the best. There is no doubt about it! Place is popular, a lot of people were there! The decor is very over powering, stuff everywhere! Looks like a bunch of junk to me? Any way I'm not there to look! I am there to eat!! All three of us had breakfast, the usual! Biscuit and gravy, eggs, hash browns, bacon, skillet, and I had the waffle. Food was good, there is no doubt about it! You will not be disappointed in the food. But is was not the best!! I have had much better. So we walked away satisfied, and would come back. But don't tell me this is the best place around.

sdBGQSSRklLqt2OnSEZKQw.text: Pecan cinnamon roll was amazing & there bacon was great according to my husband.  Eggs were good & so was the french toast.  Great ambiance with the antiques everywhere.   Nice place to go try & have a good meal & relax.

Pan4WI6g-beg3SI6vG_lSQ.text: I wish I could remember my servers name but she was awesome! Those warm mini muffins are delicious! Love this Glendale breakfast spot! Did I mention those muffins!

CsnNaIglaJ_M0Y54ZmmiyQ.text: Loved it!!! My first time here, and I can honestly say we got both good food and good service!!!  We had the muffins, cinnamon rolls, seafood omelette, and pancakes. Food was outstanding and the people were extremely nice.

qdIclmTySAJlIRUT5EBsGw.text: We are in town on vacation and had been searching for a great underdog breakfast spot.  Kiss The Cook was exactly what we were looking for!  The whole atmosphere was lovely and the decor was kitschy, including the mismatched chairs.  We had the most wonderful waitress, the omelets were great and pancakes were divine.  Of course the complimentary piping hot zucchini muffins didn't hurt either.  The best restaurant find we've had on our trip.

g9Kab3ZIA4wJBqdCkann9A.text: This place was so cute! The waitresses were super friendly and the food was amazing! Try their pecan cinnamon rolls...they are to die for! I will definitely be back!!!

yPCZMD2aWU9O5098d63W2g.text: After attending an event in downtown Glendale, my friend and I had brunch here today and loved it. We loved the antique look and feel of the restaurant and did not have to wait to be seated. The waitstaff was friendly and eager to serve. The mini muffins were fantastic and our food was delivered quickly. We both had the breakfast that served 2 eggs, bacon or sausage,  pancakes and we both added the potatoes. I was pleased that they had turkey sausage to substitute for regular sausage. The feed was tasty and the price was excellent. We got out of there spending $10 each including tip. I will definitely be back.

-_5l5lEsRW8BiB5jmS1GVg.text: Great coffee, delicious basket of muffins and biscuits and gravy. Courteous staff. Highly recommend it!

QkWnneoV17VC6MKj1xjZ4w.text: Little bit of a wait. Food is good nothing fancy. fresh and delicious. muffin basket is excellent.

qZ39-Bephxbd_Z6_JjHy6A.text: There will more than likely be a line for the indoor seating area because it is small, but there is a large patio that's open. The wait is for a reason because the food is really good. I recommend the Cajun Benedict because that Cajun sauce is especially good. Meal starts our with a variety of little muffins that are absolutely delicious as well. Great "neighborhood feel" to this place!

wDfAaT4VfUfg7ugi-48bXQ.text: The food wasn't bad but it wasn't anything special either. The five of us each got a different dish so we can have variety. The best was the eggs Benedict. Pumpkin pancakes had too much cinnamon. I got the corned beef hash which was over salted. Definitely prefer the corned beef hash at The Place. They had fresh squeezed orange juice on the menu but when we asked, we were told it was out of the box. I ordered a side of thick cut bacon which turned out to look like regular bacon. We were reassured that it was wider then the other bacon. I don't like this False advertising of menu items. The only saving grace was the mini muffins but I'm not sure if its worth a trip back. Maybe if I happen to be around the area.

6q_bDnA6ZjELVzndyg5a9Q.text: A lovely, charming breakfast place!  The menu was unique, the prices were excellent, and service was friendly.  The basket of mini-muffins was a great touch.  Our food was served hot and fresh, and it was clear that everything is "homemade" - nothing seemed canned, frozen, or store-bought.  Even the fruit was 100% fresh!  My only critique, which I know doesn't matter to some, is that the coffee mugs are very small and I had to keep requesting a refill.  But I will definitely be back here!

isWFijfxdtyb1c38jtHscQ.text: I was pleased with my food - basic breakfast - but others in the group were disappointed because they were comparing it to their favorite Bobos in Tucson.  The host was completely lost.  The waitress was good.  The basket of muffins bland.

_UC2lQWOcqS0KhXWcb3uFA.text: Came hungry and left happy, full, and knowing I will be back! Great atmosphere, service was awesome, and food was exactly what I wanted.

vJSi32WCuuMzsSPIH3U4lw.text: Aw we love this place! The waitresses are so nice and personable. They take time out to talk to you. They seem to know the "regulars". I like that, gives a small town feel in a big city. The food is really good, better than home cooked!

ovgK4ihIwZdYYtCBbT35Mw.text: I went here about a week ago with the boy for breakfast. It was a cloudy day here in Phoenix, and we made the mistake of sitting out on the covered patio. It would have been LOVELY since it was nice and cool outside, but after we received our drinks (me, iced tea; the boy, freshly squeezed oj) and our basket o' mini muffins, it started to POUR.  The "covering" thing they have over the patio is more of a mesh to filter sunlight, as opposed to an actual solid covering type material. Our table starting to get super wet. We were sitting next to another couple who decided they were going to stick it out and finish their breakfast, but since the boy and I hadn't received our actual meals yet, we decided to check and see if we could sit inside.  They were happy to give us a table inside, and actually made a few jokes about how crazy we were to sit out there in the first place considering how cloudy/stormy it looked. We received our food shortly after being seated on the INSIDE of the restaurant. The boy got the farm special? country special? something like that, it came with pancakes, scrambled eggs, and sausage. I got whatever the other special was that was DELICIOUS potatoes, biscuits and gravy, bacon and scrambled eggs.  Our breakfast was wonderful. I loved how all the dishes and everything we mismatched, a very cute country look. Our server was fantastic. I'm sure we'll go back again. :)

RzSOKMgluSdvbAwU24Vw7g.text: Love the small town and family owned feel of this place! The staff was sweet, attentive and prompt ...even on Mother' day!

nsoqHb00FrFxX2eEsg213A.text: Went there recently on a Saturday afternoon because of some research here on yelp.  I love breakfast food even though I have it about once a month.  I could not complain about my experience whatsoever, great food, great prices, good service, and a cozy atmosphere.  Definitely not the Denny's experience which I thought this place would be.  My only complaint is the location, I enjoy downtown Glendale, but this place is a little ways from it next to tattoo parlors and check cashing stores.  Wish it was downtown so I could enjoy the shops after a scrumptious meal.  Overall this place is worth a shot!

JiTB8vqqmpfPsj-FBLb0dg.text: Based on fellow Yelpers we checked out KTC this morning... Not too bad - Cute inside, we were in the back room which was a little dark... muffin basket that reviewers have noted was just small bran muffins... not awesome, but ok.  The staff (esp Donna) was attentive and the food came out quickly.  Definitely better than Denny's...

e9IsynbknsX6AsXAWzu6yg.text: went for first time week ago.. wont be our last.. wait staff very nice and food very good... enjoyed the experience

3SECEC7uZnFE3nI1VD2fbA.text: We went to Kiss The Cook for first time two weeks ago. Even tho we had to wait it really was the 15 minutes we were told. The place was very crowded but server was friendly. Pretty good green chili omelette and Cajun eggs Benedict.  Went a second time last Sunday, this time the server was distracted, didn't bring the mini muffins until asked and coffee refills were non existent. We had the green chili omelette and special Burger Slider eggs Benedict which was English muffin -except not on mine, hamburger patties-the size of half dollars one undercooked  and one extremely overcooked, grilled onions-except not on mine, grilled tomato- one very thin slice for two eggs, eggs, sauce, and cheddar cheese-again except not on mine. The food came out 5 minutes apart with the Benedict first.  When we said something to the server about the missing parts of the Benedict her response was "Oh, I'm sorry".  That was it.  When we told the hostess/cashier about the poor food quality...same response "Oh, I'm sorry".  We tried to get someone from Kiss The Cook to acknowledge poor food, poor service and poor responsibility.  Never happened.  We eat breakfast out every weekend. We will not be returning to this place.
